Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Nicole M
Reviews.Content: We just left a 3 night stay at this hotel, the staff was very nice when you checked in, at any point when you had a question and the breakfast was a nice surprise. I would suggest this hotel to anyone looking to stay in this area. We also loved the extra room in the kitchen and fridge. One small suggestion for the hotel is to move the bed away from the wall, it was hard to get out of oneside of the bed because of where the wall came out a bit futher.

Reviews.Title: “Too pricey...”
Reviews.Author: ricik
Reviews.Content: We were there in Dec/2011 - 2 adults and a 10 year old boy. The good: Location (B.Hills) and a Breakfast supervisor (He is french). The bad: Room was ok but third bed was lousy (sofa bed). It took ages for the room to be cleaned Front desk arrogant (cannot remember the name of emplyee). Pricey. We would try elsewhere for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value close to Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: MenloMichael
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice, once in 2009 and again in 2012. I had a pleasant experience both times. The hotel is very convenient to Beverly Hills, but is much less expensive than hotels in Beverly Hills itself (such as the Beverly Hilton or even more expensive ones). The rooms have comfy beds, a mini-kitchen, and nice little touches such as two-layer shower curtains and electric outlets on the lamps to charge up portable electronics. There is a free happy hour in the lounge many weeknights and an included full breakfast. One parking tip: there is a self-park lot which is slightly cheaper than the valet parking -- to get into the lot, you need to check in and get your room key first to get through the gate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: UKStevieH
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms with cooking facilities but hardly any have a double bed where both parties have a bedside cabinet. This is strange as the room is big enough but not designed for two. We moved to a smaller room just to get a bed where one person doesn't have to climb over the other to get out. Good location though and frendly, efficient valets if you are driving. Breakfast was OK for one of thes types of places and they don't mind you taking out food. Good value option if you need to be near the rich folks.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: townsend416
Reviews.Content: Really excellent value - great combo of price, location and amenities. The location is great - just off Pico in Beverly hills - easy acess to West Hollywood, Century City, Santa Monica, etc. Nicely sized rooms overall; I would recommend this for a family or group of friends -- especially for longer stays, as they have a kitchenette, etc. The complimentary breakfast and happy hour are a very nice touch -- also love that the staff will pick up groceries for you nearby and deliver them! Opt to self park - valet is not really necessary. Did not get to use the spa, but they do have one on site - a pleasant surprise for this type of property. Overall - a hidden gem in the middle of Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: cplisner
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for visitors who do not need a full service resort. We just returned from our second stay there this year and found it to be another outstanding experience. Spotlessly clean with wonderful staff from the front desk to the valet and breakfast servers. I love the location with its wonderful diversity and proximity to shopping, dining and expressways. Well done Residence Inn!

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: Deborah525
Reviews.Content: A nice residence inn right near all the kosher restaurants on Pico. A short walk to an orthodox synagogue.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like Home and Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Call_me_Marie
Reviews.Content: All staffs are very friendly and helpful, and even the guests! I think good people attract other good people. Feels like home a lot. The room is clean, quite and completely equipped. Comfy bed. Hotel location? Beverly Hills and Rodeo Dr. are just within walking distance, other tourist attractions and cafes/ bars also very near. I can say the hotel is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel that makes a Road Warrior feel at Home”
Reviews.Author: HOTELBOBBY
Reviews.Content: A few times each year I need to travel to Los Angeles on business and my stay usually is for about 2 weeks. I have found that hotels equiped to cater to the long term customer works best for me. My favorite hotel in LA is the Residense Inn in Beverly Hills. I was so happy when I arrived and the front desk remembered me. The hotel has recently been renovated and the suites are amazing. Up to date decor and all the conveniences of being home. They stock my refrigerator with the snacks and beverages I usually have at my house. The large screen TV and On Demand make those evenings watching TV relaxing. The best amenity is the Full Breakfast included in your room price. From fresh fruit, juices, breads to eggs and meats. The breakfast room is comfortable a nice place to meet fellow travelers or friends. Thanks to Michael Damodio the GM and his team for making my bi annual visits so welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Residence Inn Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: murphykds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Residence Inn on a trip to the Rose Bowl. First, its not in Beverly Hills it is on a very noisy corner of Pico and Beverly Blvd. There is a Vons market across the street but for everything else you have to drive. From start to finish this was a sad story of poor facilities and horrible service. Check in was fairly easy however I had requested an upper floor away from the stairwell and I got a lower floor right next to the stairwell. The major problems started when we walked in the room (very small and poorly maintained). We found that the cloths rack in the closet was broken and the plug in the bathroom was broken--both things that were very visible to housekeeping. Called down and had someone come up and fix. The next day we had trouble with the safe and happened to notice that a low battery signal was flashing (thanks heavens we noticed then and not when we were leaving at 5:00 a.m. and needed our Rose parade and Rose bowl tickets). Had someone come up and change the battery but again this is a basic maintenance issue. Housekeeping was horrible. Towels were not stocked, coffee pot not emptied, bathroom sink not cleaned, crumbs still on the kitchen counter top. Second night I specifically asked to have more towels delivered the next day as my cousin was joining us. Not only did we not get extra towels but we got fewer towels than the first day. And then there was the parking.--$22 a day for secure parking. Problem was that they kept the gate open all weekend so there was nothing secure about the parking. So people who checked in on Saturday just drove in the parking lot and weren't charged while those of us who checked in on Thursday and Friday paid for the entire stay. Of greater concern were the 40+ car arson fires, some less than a mile from our location yet the hotel didn't keep its garage secure. When I asked, every time I was assured that the gate was being fixed. Breakfast was not restocked. If you didn't get down before 8:30 there was not much left. And I always love the fact that Marriott wants you to reuse towels and sheets to protect the environment, but they use enough Styrofoam to fill a landfill. Just a poor hotel all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, But Below Marriot Standards”
Reviews.Author: Dennis C
Reviews.Content: We have come to expect the best from this Company. This property, falls short in some areas. The studio suite we stayed in with a queen size bed, was small. The placement of the bed, allowed access from only one side of the bed. If your by yourself, its no problem, but for 2 people, and being senior, one must crawl into bed from the other side. If a late night trip to the bathroom is needed, and not wake the other person, get ready to crawl out the front of the bed. Not a very good setup. The breakfast was ok.....something you would find at a days inn, not up to marriot standards, Only one elevator working the day we were leaving....being on a lower floor, elvator was always full to get to the lobby. Had to walk the stairs. Being handicapped did not help the situation. There is free wifi ok kitchen, and a ipod docking station.,, and the valet parking was great. Parking garage is a bit of challenge if you self park. I wrote management in response to their email on how i enjoyed the stay. They apoligized for the elevator, and said that if I called in advance, they would see if they could find a room with a bed that had access from both sides. Am I missing something ? I have never stayed in a room at these rates that was not big enough to accomodate walking room around the bed. I love the Marriot Brand, but it seems that this property must have belonged to some other company, and Marriot tried to raise it to their standards. I will always try to stay at a Marriot Property, but will start asking more questions by calling direct, rather than booking on line.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location”
Reviews.Author: CastlecragCouple
Reviews.Content: The main reason we chose this hotel was because it had a full kitchen (we were travelling with young children), had two bedroom suites, had breakfast included and seemed close to tourist attractions in Beverly Hills. Our experience there was OK but not great. The rooms were tiny!!! Breakfast was OK but only plastic knives and forks and plates were supplied. Very tacky. The hotel was not really close to anything (except one nice deli). Basically the location of this hotel is not good for tourists. Would not stay there again and would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It is not walking distance”
Reviews.Author: Dextercun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I when to LA for a long weekend. I ready do not understand way the said the location is great. The location is not that Great !!! It is a LONG walk to Beverly Hills or Rodeo Drive where the action take place. For me walking distance is no more that 3 or 4 blocks but it was about 10 blocks. The hotel was a little below a normal Residence Inn by Marriott standards. One night to walk back at night and I did not feel safe. On the day you can walk around but I do not recommend it at night. Finally we decide to move to another Marriott Hotel in Down Town LA in the area known as LA Live, that is a Great Location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Stevexyz
Reviews.Content: Was here for the Rosebowl, Great Room with kitchen, excellent for touring LA. Good 4star place in great location. easy access to everything, LA, Hills Pasadena, and even a 30 min drive to the beach. Famous Deli a 2min walk away. Grocery store just up the street.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite L.A. Area Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim A
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Residence Inn in Beverly Hills several times and I have yet to have a bad experience. The rooms have been recently renovated and are even more comfortable than before. The staff is knowledgeable, efficient and always friendly. The hotel is very centrally located for business meetings as well as nights on the town. I highly recommend it to anyone traveling to the L.A. area for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Warning to those in wheelchairs”
Reviews.Author: canusa32
Reviews.Content: I was excited about coming back to this hotel after a nice stay last year, so much so that I organized a trip down South with my wheelchair-bound father and his caregiver based on the availability of a 2-bedroom accessible suite. This was my first mistake! Apparently, when this hotel "confirms" a room it isn't the same as "guaranteeing" a room. And even then, it's not guaranteed. 1-2 days before our flight, I received a call from the Mariott ADA desk (kudos to them) that the 2-bedroom accessible suite wasn't available for the reserved dates. He put me on hold to confer with the hotel and when he came back to the phone said that a 1-bedroom accessible was available, and emailed a "guarantee". He said this was a firm "guarantee". While I was a bit upset because this meant I wouldn't have the option of staying in the suite and would incur the additional cost of another room, I was glad that at least the other suite was available. When we arrived at the hotel the next day, however, we were informed by the front desk that the accessible suite wasn't available until the next day :(. This meant that my ailing, 85-year old father had to come down from his room later that evening and use the public bathroom by the hotel bar so that he could have a toilet with grab bars. To be fair, the Manager was apologetic and charged for a 1-bedroom while putting them in a 2-bedroom for the night (and slightly reduced the rate for the remaining days), but this is unacceptable for a hotel of this stature and price point. The Manager promised that the accessible room would be available in the morning, and that by the time we finished breakfast the next day my dad's and caregiver's bags would be transferred to the new room. The next day at 12noon the room still wasn't ready so we went out for a couple hours. When we returned at 2pm I asked the front desk if their bags had been transferred to the room. The employee looked at us like we'd done something wrong, asking where we were and saying he'd called the room because it was past checkout time and put the bags in storage. In the transfer, some medical equipment of my dad's was lost and I had to throw out several dairy food items that had gone unrefrigerated. Needless to say, this wasn't a good way to start a vacation! Had I known weeks before while planning the trip that this was going to be the situation, I would have organized the trip differently, either making alternate hotel arrangements, or going to Palm Springs before Los Angeles so that we could be there when the 2-bedroom suite was available. If you require an accessible room or are traveling with someone who does, I recommend calling the hotel directly to obtain a guarantee for the room. Then I recommend crossing your fingers. Other than that...it's a nice hotel with modern furnishings, in a good location in-between downtown and the beach, with a yummy breakfast and social hour.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: 4snickers
Reviews.Content: This high rise inn on the very edge of Beverly Hills should have been a nice expeience for a Los Angeles based family trip. However, beware of the parking situation, when you check in you have 15 mins or less before there is a charge. I had to wait in line, then went up to the room to change, it took less than 20 minutes and they wanted a $5 charge, even though I was going to park there. I think the parking is leased out to another firm, at least I hope this isn't the Marriott way. The front desk staff was very dour and not at all happy..reflection on the mgmt of this hotel? I do have to say the cleanliness of this facility was excellent...Another issue was the hotel key kept dying, very annoying as you had to use it to get into the parking facilities. So there you are in the middle of a 4 lane boulevard and the gate won't open because you card died...aaagghh! Then you can't access your room either unless someone takes pity on you. Geezzz...We had a package and the front desk wasn't familiar and couldn't access the tickets until the next day, then I had FOUR phone calls before 9 am asking our name, then to say the tiks were ready, then to say a cab I hadn't ordered was here, then just a wrong number! AAAGGGHHH, I thought hotels were for sleeping!

Reviews.Title: “very small rooms, average property”
Reviews.Author: Wtravel66
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom suite and it was SMALL! Literally there was NOWHERE to put my 30" duffle bag in the bedroom. It could just fit a queen bed, that's it. I ended up keeping it in the bathroom. My room had a window into the "courtyard" with some really loud machine noise coming through late into the night. The property is pretty basic. There is even no restaurant on presmises, no room service, no facilities at all. It's kind of gloomy and looks dirty in places. Understaffed, for sure. Reception people were perfectly pleasant, but then there was no one to take the bags to our room. We ended up hauling them ourselves. Parking is valet and $25 extra. Breakfast is the usual powdered eggs, bagels and waffles, passible, but nothing to write home about. Very average property overall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: 65Sharon
Reviews.Content: The staff are very accommodating, friendly, and attentive. We had booked with the Crowne Plaza Hotel across the road and found the rooms extremely small and not nice looking. We hadn't prepaid so decided to look at the Residence Inn across the road and after looking at one room immediately cancelled Crowne Plaza and moved over to the Residence Inn. Great choice. The hotel's central location is amazing. Minutes from Hollywood, Beverly Hills shopping and restaurants. We were able to walk (about half hour) from Rodeo Drive to our hotel and also there was a free shuttle that you can prebook and will drive you within 3 miles of hotel. Closeby bus stop to get you quickly to Santa Monica (Great shopping/restaurants and lovely pier) and Venice Beach. Shops, restaurants, pharmacies, markets and gyms are walking distance. Hollywood sight seeing is nearby. We caught the free hotel shuttle bus to the 'hop on hop off' bus stop on W 3rd Avenue which took us all around the sights of Hollywood, Beverly Hills, etc. Well worth it for orientation. The rooms are clean and family friendly with kitchenettes. The daily breakfast and happy hour are a big plus. Breakfast was great with lots of choices. Free wifi in the room was great and business centre to print boarding passes for plane trip. My son enjoyed the fitness facilities and the spa and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent traveler to LA and I always return to this centrally located hotel. .”
Reviews.Author: PJBlue
Reviews.Content: The staff and management are completely accommodating, friendly, and attentive. The hotel's central location is amazing. Minutes from Hollywood, WEHO, Beverly Hills shopping and restaurants. Just off 405 and 10 can get you quickly to Santa Monica, the Valley, LAX, and all of LA. Shops, restaurants, pharmacies, markets and gyms are walking distance. Hollywood site seeing is nearby as well as great hiking at Runyon Canyon Park. Just off Pico Blvd offers quick shortcuts to most of LA. The rooms are clean and family friendly with kitchenettes. As a frequent LA traveler, I always return to this Marriott because of the staff, the location, and it's amenities. The daily breakfast and happy hour are a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FAMILY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: spm203
Reviews.Content: Three generations needed a resonable place to stay. This hotel was the place. It has two bedroom suites that have kitchen and sitting areas. There is free breakfast. The area is convenient to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Gloomy...”
Reviews.Author: Froimo
Reviews.Content: It has all the convenience associated with Residense Inns (kitchen area, breakfast included, spacious) but overpriced due to location. They didn't clean our rooms during entire stay (one day they offered to do so at 5 PM, but we didn't want to have to leave the room then...) The place is gloomy! And for being in Beverly Hills, it makes you sad to go back inside your room at the end of the day!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Location with Outstanding Features”
Reviews.Author: Robin K
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Residence Inn by Marriott located at 1177 S. Beverly Dr. in the Beverly Hills section of Los Angeles. It was a delight to stay at such a convenient location, so close to all the LA freeways for ease of travel but also within walking distance of so much that this partially residential, partially commercial area has to offer (right at the corner of Beverly Drive and Pico Blvd.). The over-sized room included all the amenities of a Residence Inn (refrigerator, microwave, etc.) and of course the free popcorn and coffee. We thoroughly enjoyed the buffet breakfast also included in the rate. What a hidden gem this place turned out to be with a super friendly staff, convenient parking (competitively priced for the neighborhood) and many unexpected extras.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE SERVICE! NOT IN BEVERLY HILLS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travel_well810
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware! First off, the name is misleading - this is not a hotel in beverly hills, it's actually in los angeles and is far from a beverly hills adjacent hotel. The staff and service there is NOT EVEN CLOSE to what you should expect at a Marriott. I think they hire ex-cons and hoodlems to run their front desk. They made me take my bags up to my room myself as they only had one bellman. Any requests or favors you ask will be turned down. They are woefully understaffed and only have 1 person handling all the bags and all the cars. Expect to spend most of your time waiting for something if you have a request. Other issues they dont tell you about: 1. Parking is $25 dollars / night and there is no street parking available. 2. Their rooms and hallways wreaked of marijuana and smoke - so you know what type of people are hanging out there. 3. The breakfast is terrible and the dining room is very dirty 4. They give you used sheets. This hotel has terrible reviews and deserves them because of their staff. If I had to pay an extra 100 dollars to go across the street to stay at the crown plaza, it would be well worth while. I would NEVER stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: charles073
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good very quiet The staff is friendly and helpful The valet parking was very fast The breakfast which is included was full however there is a lack of space, They give a newspaper even on weekends

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant Thanksgiving stay”
Reviews.Author: jmasgat
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4-night stay here and it was very comfortable. We had an inner-courtyard room, which was preferable since I am not a good sleeper away from home and always hear every noise. This trip, I was able to sleep without ear plugs every night--no problem. I chose this hotel on the basis of room type (wanted a kitchen), location (on the edge of Beverly Hills and on Pico--which is a reasonable east-west route through LA) and price. My intent was to cook Thanksgiving dinner. My mistake was not recognizing that the rooms have no ovens! So I modified our plans and it still worked out well. It's nice to be able to roll downstairs in the am and eat breakfast. They had a fairly standard breakfast buffet with cereal, fruit, yogurt, make-your-own-waffles, pastries, bagels. They also had scrambled eggs and some type of meat (sausage, ham). One day they had someone doing omelets, but not the other 3 days. We also went to one afternoon reception, where they had burgers and beer/wine. I used the small exercise room one day to run, which worked out well. They have 2 treadmills and a couple of bikes, along with some free weights and a weight machine. Parking was self-park or valet. We chose self-park and it was fine and cost $22/nt. Finally, one thing I really noticed--the staff was very friendly. They always said hello with a smile, I don't usually pay attention to this, but it was distinctly noticeable. I would stay here again. It met our specific needs nicely.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: izu41
Reviews.Content: we stay in this hotel for 6 nights in june 2010 with our children and grandchildren and enjoy very much our stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great place, really clean & quiet”
Reviews.Author: BobField
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. We stayed for a recent weekend - very conveniently located. The hotel is a couple blocks from the main part of Beverly Hills. Great breakfast, friendly staff. Only complaint was the $25/night for parking - but I guess it was fair. Really quiet - a big plus. Very close to the kosher restaurants on Pico.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing short of classy!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffncali
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from parking to room to breakfast and everything inbetween. Very nice room and quiet. Staff was friendly and prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, GREAT place”
Reviews.Author: cldkRidgecrest_CA
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for some affordable space in a GREAT location, consider the Residence Inn. For locations in Beverly Hills they run a shuttle service which is nice. The suites are beautifully maintained and the breakfast is a bonus. Try it you'll like it

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay and would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Donna C
Reviews.Content: Came as a result of Priceline.com We paid about $149.00 for the night. Included was a hot buffet breakfast, make your own waffles, and the place had its own kitchen, sofa, and flat LCD large TV. They even had two computers and printers at the bottom floor, all for free. The staff was especially helpful. The room was pretty big, the bedding was super soft. I also thought my room was very clean. I liked the shampoo, conditioner, and lotion, too. The workout room was a little small but it did have lots of towels and a water cooler, as well as personal TV's on each of the machines. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline33197
Reviews.Content: My 2 girlfriends and I stayed here from a Thursday to Sunday. Beautiful 2 bedroom suite. We had 2 bathrooms, a kitchen and a family room. Having more than one bathroom was a life saver since there were three of us girls! It felt like home! Nice and clean. The beds were very comfortable! The street noise was hard to ignore, but this did not keep me up. The staff was great starting from the valet parking to the check-in! Concierge was very nice, too! Great customer service overall. Would definitely stay here in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the modern room, omelet station (breakfast), and the location!”
Reviews.Author: Dreamscometrue1227
Reviews.Content: I loved, loved, loved Residence Inn Beverly Hills. First, I give you two cons so that some of the people can skip reading the rest of my review. There is no pool (only a huge hot tub) and the gym is not very nice (it is in the basement and hubbie said one of the two treadmills was not working). In spite of these cons, I still give it 5 stars because of all the pros. The room looked newly renovated. The kitchen was very modern, and the furniture was beautiful. We had a nice view of mountains in the distance. The maids did a great job cleaning the room and doing all the dishes every day. As for breakfast, their omelet station during the weekdays was a huge plus for me. I have not seen an omelet station in any other RIs. The location is superb. It is not in the center of Beverly Hills, but is a short walk to the area on Beverly Drive where you find many nice restaurants and shops. Rodeo drive is about a mile away. We went to Santa Monica beach often, and it was a convenient short drive. I think the value you get for the price is really great. The staff were courteous and kind. We will definitely go back there for our next trip to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Javier G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the residence Inn and since I arrived the treatment was Amazing They are very professional and make you feel at home. I was really impressed. they have every day complementary breakfast and also tacos, wine and beer in the afternoon. the rooms are big and modern. the staff is flawless. i recommend it to everyone. Javier Gomez

Reviews.Title: “Room with no view and plenty of space”
Reviews.Author: Brock_Samson_42
Reviews.Content: It is a decent room with better than expected service personnel. Carpet is old. There is not a view from most rooms. The breakfast is very bad. They have a nice after work social area with free beer and gnosh.

Reviews.Title: “Weekends away”
Reviews.Author: Joseph_B_Conrad
Reviews.Content: I always try to stay at Marriotts when away from home, but this was my first time at a Residence Inn. My wife and I were very impressed with the over all experience, from check-in to check-out. The Beverly Hills location is centrally located for the areas attractions, but is still easy to move in and out of. The staff was very patient and pleasant, even during the free breakfast rush hour, which would distroy a lesser person. The rooms are amazingly clean and organized. They have a modern feel, and are spacious and comfortable. We really enjoy the idea of a kitchenette so there is not always the need to leave to find food. Overall our experience was outstanding, this has become our new weekend get away spot.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Residence Inn by Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Calif_Otter
Reviews.Content: I had to find a hotel in an emergency and while of late, I've not been picking Marriotts because those that I had stayed in over the last two years were warn, this Marriott was at top notch. The facilities were immaculate, the price was fare, and the people were delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: blibin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very popular in the summer and for good reason. If you have to be in Beverly Hills or the Pico Robertson location it doesn't get better for the price. We arrived on July 21, and stayed over the weekend. You have to expect to pay for parking in this part of town. The parking lot has lots of space even when the hotel is full. Park closer to the top of the parking garage and there is a hotel entrance on the top floor. It is easier than having to walk back out onto the street throught the garage gate. The hotel rooms are very nice for the price with a fully equipped kitchen. There is street noise that you can hear through the windows. Internet is included. Comfortable bed and adequate bathroom. The complimentary breakfast is OK, but like all hotels at full capacity very busy. There are omlettes made to order during the week, but not on the weekend. Everything is close by this hotel, Beverly Hills is walking distance, The Museum of Tolerance is two blocks away. The Pico shopping area is around the corner. Ralph's supermarket is two blocks away. Its an easy drive to Santa Monica, Downtown LA and the airport. You can't find anything of this calibre in Beverly Hills for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: Mitchell C
Reviews.Content: For a Residnece Inn, it was just OK. The oading and unloading/parking is horrible. Definitely do not pay for valet--it takes much longer. Pay for the self-park, which lets you park on the top floor of the adjacent garage and then you can enter the hotel on the fourth floor. Definitely more convenient when you are in and out for the day. You must chec in first to get your room key to let you in for the parking. There is no service elevator so all of the guests and the work staff make elevator travel up and down at check out and check in times overly rough, especially since there are just two relatively small elevators. One of the elevators was broken down while we were there so that made it worse. We used the stairs a lot since we were parked in the garage! The room was a little more crammed than a typical Residence Inn. The reservation agent had promised rollaway beds but the hotel told us when we arrived that they do not have rollaways. So, if you need anything that is not standard, I suggest you call the hotel directly and not just rely on the central reservation service.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient spot!”
Reviews.Author: DAAziz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for a week. The rooms were spacious and clean, well-equipped with all the needed facilities for business. The kitchen area was just nice. Eateries around the inn were mostly koshers', so this was very convenient for us. The staff were helpful and public transport was easy from the inn. Although we got bored with the daily breakfast, we had lots of other affordable alternatives nearby. Surprisingly nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Staff were great, especially Serena B!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiego3
Reviews.Content: Combined business and pleasure trip. All staff were friendly and eager to help. Serena went out of her way to help me out. only issue was a continuing problem with one of the only 2 elevators...they need to get that remedied.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and service”
Reviews.Author: PJBlue
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here this year. The staff, management, and valet are courteous, which all makes for a pleasant stay. Again the hotel is perfectly situated for West Hollywood, Beverly Hills, and really anywhere in the LA area. You are walking distance from Beverly Hills shops and restaurants. Also near the hotel is a supermarket which is convenient as the rooms are suites with kitchenettes. Located on the corner of Pico Blvd., can take you anywhere in the LA area if you want to avoid freeways. But the 10 to the coast and the 405 to the airport or the Valley are also nearby. Made to order omellets and a full breakfast is served everyday. Every night there is a complimentary buffet dinner with red and white wines as well as soft drinks and beer. You're also less than 5 minutes from the West Hollywood nightlife and shops and short drive to the Beverly shopping center and the Nordstrom center. Also a short drive to Hollywood sightseeing, or the thrilling hike at Runyon Canyon Park which makes for a great workout. Free wifi in the rooms and hotel computers with printers for guest use. What more can I say!? I absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed because it's pet friendly, but that's about all it offers.”
Reviews.Author: Kurt2010
Reviews.Content: Decent size, small kitchen. Elevators are super slow, and the two of them are inadequate for the size of the hotel. Staff carrying vacuums and cleaning carts, insists on boarding elevators, even if they're already crowded. One staffer got on, carrying nothing and asked my wife to press his floor numbers, no please and no thank you. I left tip for housekeeping each time, yet they didn't even replace the face cloths or clean the coffee table. Vent for AC is at head level on one side of the bed. No swimming pool. Rooms are middle of the road, overall Valet parking staff very friendly. Aside from the valet parking staff and one of the front desk staff, the rest of the hotel was rather dour.

Reviews.Title: “A really great experience”
Reviews.Author: Welikeitcomfortable
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Residence Inn for 4 days for a family vacation to Los Angeles to see friends. We stayed in a suite that was very spacious with a very nice kitchen and comfortable beds. The rooms were very nicely designed and were comfortable for 2 adults and 2 children. The hotel provides a complimentary free breakfast in the morning from 7-9 that is definitely worth attending. The breakfast is great for kids too because they provide 2 waffle makers and cereals along with a chef to cook omelets. The food was a really great amenity considering it was free breakfast for the whole family all 4 days. We brought along a laptop to watch netflix and movies on and it was really nice that the hotel provided free wifi so the kids could watch movies while we went down to the evening social hours. The hotel has a small bar in the lobby with a good selection of beer and wine at a pretty reasonable price that is worth attending if you want to have a few drinks but don't want to venture into the downtown area. The location is actually one of the best parts because it's really central to a lot of places you'd want to visit. It is only about a 5 minute walk from Rodeo Dr. and near a lot of restaurants and nightlife. It is also relatively easy to get yourself onto the freeway and head down to Hermosa or Manhattan Beach for a nice bike ride or walk along the strand. We are really lucky to have picked this location because it made the whole trip that much more enjoyable. We definitely will choose to stay at this hotel again next time we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't really feel like a Marriott??”
Reviews.Author: JeannieChiliBeanie
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of Residence Inns, including others in Southern California. This one is distinct in at least three ways: 1) They charge -- a lot -- for parking. 2) The interior is dark and a little ominous 3) The fitness room is in a corner of the sub-basement that is stuffy and unsettling to get to/work out in (although the equipment is great and works well). I associate Residence Inns with a sort of "welcome home Americana" brightness and this definitely had a more urban and closed in affect. In a property this size with limited stair access I found myself sharing the elevator with the housekeeping staff most of the time. The room was great -- clean and well appointed, but I had a hard time getting that good ol' fashioned happy Marriott feeling going -- price/value is pretty good for being in Beverly Hills, however. You won't be unhappy here -- just be prepared for a different experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for family”
Reviews.Author: Bu3teeg
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in LA for 2 weeks and have chosen with the family to stay at this hotel mainly for its location. In my opinion, it was situated almost in the middle of everything, you have disney 1 hr away, 20 min to Universal studios and Hollywoods, 2 hrs to Sea world in San Diego, and very close to the rest of the main areas like Anaheim, Irvine, Santa Monica, etc. Also close to the main shopping area in Beverly Hills like Rodeo drive. The rooms/suites were clean and the staff are helpful. It's not a 5 stars, but decent one though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: acpa1120
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great location not to far from Beverly Hills shopping. Very professional and courteous staff!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - But Horrible Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Man1122
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and was in a great location, but a bit far from where most of our sightseeing was. Factor's Deli across the street had awesome sandwhiches, but a bit pricy though. The free buffet in the morning really helped us save money and made my stay a whole lot better! But it also has a Ralph's which is about a two minute walk from the hotel where you can get all of your groceries you need. The only bad part about the hotel was the sleep. About every 20 minutes the air conditioning would come on and it was loud. The first night it kept waking me up and I couldn't get to sleep. The second night I decided to sleep on the pull out bed in the couch. It was a little bit better but you could still hear it and it was not confy at all. The third night I decided to sleep on the pull out bed again but put it on the floor because I thought it would be more confy, but I was wrong. The forth night I decided to sleep in the bed that I slept in on the first night because there was nothing I could really do about it. In all of the hotels I have stayed at in my entire life, I have never had a worse sleep than that - they have to fix it! If you don't mind about the air conditioning then this would be an awesome hotel for you, but if you do mind, then don't stay here. I gave it a four out of five because of the good location, clean rooms, free buffet etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel ok location”
Reviews.Author: atlantisluver
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed here first week of July, very nice hotel, rooms are large with full kitchen facilities. Staff are also very nice. Breakfast was included every morning which was great. No pool though. Free wifi all over the hotel which came in handy. Only cons would be the location, no bars or restaurants within walking distance. Rodeo drive is a 10 min walk, Hollywood blvd and n highland are about a 10-12 min drive. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “From what I saw, it was OK.”
Reviews.Author: daf62757
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation here for my wife and her grand kids to stay after a day at Universal Theme Park. It isn't really in Beverly Hills, so the name is a little off, but its a nice RI and always better than your usual hotel/motel room. The morning breakfast was not very long and we missed it. After a grueling day at Universal, we wanted to sleep in and then eat. We had to find a place to eat breakfast because the breakfast closed very early. None of their rooms had two queen or double beds so the kids had to sleep on a sleeper couch. A horrible option, but it was that or the floor. The only item where they did a really good job was getting my CPAP machine back to me after I forgot it. The day after I got back home, the machine arrived. Overall, not good for a family, but for business or trip with partner/wife it is very goof choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: 4kristina
Reviews.Content: We had a family trip planned for San Diego, but I came in a few days early to show my teenagers LA. This was the perfect place to stay. Front desk staff so friendly and professional. Valet was very fast. Eddie provided very helpful information about driving routes and best places to bring my teenagers. Breakfast was wonderful. Very impressed with the quality of service. Room was very clean too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel - especiallly for kosher food in the LA area”
Reviews.Author: UsKosherTraveler
Reviews.Content: Large rooms well appointed - friendly staff. Centrally located. I'd suggest seriously thinking about this.Have "Pure" air rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cplisner
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay at the Beverly Hills Residence Inn. We used points and were pleasantly surprised at the ourstanding value. Lovely service and conveneint location. Quick valet and a well managed breakfast. We were in town visiting relatives and didnt miss the resort amentities of a typical hotel and we appreciated the time and money saved with our breakfast. This will certainly be our go to spot when we visit our family in the LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!!!”
Reviews.Author: BigMetsFan
Reviews.Content: Until we moved to LA we stayed in this hotel several times a year for 5 years. Since then we have had visitors stay at this Residence Inn. I assure you that this hotel is VERY clean, well maintained and has comfortable beds. Our main concern is cleanliness and you won't go wrong here. The management is wonderful, caring and the manger has gone out of his way to help us many times. Stay here when you come to town. It was indeed our "home away from home" whenever we came from NY......BigMetsFan

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service and Feel Like Home”
Reviews.Author: Kalani_1111
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott Residence Inn Beverly Hills - June 10th thru 12th. It was everything I expected being near/close to Rodeo Drive and with so many things to do. My room (217) was very spacious and candy for the eyes. The decor and layout was so inviting and truly made my stay "Feel like home!". I am very picky and known to be high maintenance personality. I must admit that the staff was very informative and always had a wonderful smile. I travel allot for work and can't help but to compare?, even though this was a pleasure trip. Even the valet service had my car ready before I arrived downstairs (simply dial #2), even for departing - late nights. The hotel is located on Beverly and Pico - central to the best of all the great restaurants and so many sight seeing adventures awaiting. I live in San Diego, and it was worth the 2 hour drive, which turned out to be worth my time and travel. Most of all a great experience and looking forward to my next stay/visit for Halloween. "Top Notch Service and Feel Like Home"...is a Win-Win situation, I'm sure you're experience will be just as wonderul...Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: CarolyneMD
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded what I had imagined. Nothing elaborate, but in three words- trendy, neat, warm. The free breakfast was just great! A lot of variety for your money's worth. Staff was incredible- especially the kitchen staff and the front desk crew. If you are too fussy, and complain unnecessarily, you will definitely find something wrong with this hotel, so don't bother. Location worked perfectly for my husband and I. We were there for the purpose of sight- seeing and having just plain fun! Proximity to Universal studios, Hollywood sights, 2 hour drive to San Diego. Our vacation was perfect. Thank you to all the staff of Marriott Residence Inn Beverly Hills. I will definitely recommend this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stress-free, relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: jmendias
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located with easy access to Rodeo Drive, Santa Monica Blvd., the beach and LAX. Nice, clean rooms with warm and friendly staff make this a quiet oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: TXtravelingirl
Reviews.Content: Love this place! The rooms were very spacious and clean. The complimentary breakfast was delioucous and included homemade waffles andvmade to order omletes. The location is perfect for LA sightseeing. We were a short drive from all the hot spots, Hollywood, rodeo drive, century city, Santa Monica, just to name a few. Service was top notch and look forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: san_diego7950
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on may 15th &16th for my wife's bday! We drove up from San Diego and got to the hotel around noon. I told the desk that it was my wife's bday and if we could check in. The gentleman at the desk, Mr. Tekin checked us in right away and asked me; " Sir, white or red"? Red. So I got a nice bottle of red wine and it really made both of us feel special. The breakfast and Wifi was complimentary which helped us to safe more money on our weekend. Thank you for listening and making us feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: UTLonghorn_Fan
Reviews.Content: The staff was incredibly welcoming and accommodating. The room was magnificent and the staff took care of me all weekend! Itâ€™s within walking distance to Rodeo Drive. Complimentary breakfast (especially the cooked-to-order omelet). is a must, very yummy. I will definitely stay here on my next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thomfre
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week in august 2010, got a huge room with a small kitchen. The microwave was missing, but we got one quickly after notifying the staff. Got a room with windows facing the street, but there were not much noise and sleeping was no problem! Breakfast was very good. There were taxis parked right outside at all times, so getting around was very easy! The only thing I find a bit strange is that I got a 5$ charge on my credit card a few days after we left, but the bill stated 0$, and everything was pre-paid. Eddie, the Concierage, was extremely helpful with arranging tours and giving information and directions - Thank you, Eddie! I would recommend this hotel to anyone! And the next time I'm in Beverly Hills, I know where to stay!

Reviews.Title: “BedBugs Beware! For being in BH you would think the place is upscale but it is NOT!”
Reviews.Author: Fendi32
Reviews.Content: I had booked a three day stay at the Beverly Hills Residence Inn. They allow pets and have "long term" residence. The first day I check in I go to bed around 11PM and woke up around 3Am with bites all over my face and arms! I immediatley called the front desk and they told me I had to wait to switch rooms when the manager came on schedule. I checked online to make sure they were not spider bites, and low and behold, they are damn bed bug bites! GROSS! How obsured! I packed my things, and switched rooms a couple of hours later. I was very upset and the front desk did not even offer a refund. They knew they had bed bugs, and it is disgusting! I will never return to this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Beverly Hills Motel”
Reviews.Author: juzmuz
Reviews.Content: We had a comfotable stay, staff were very helpful and the lady making the omletes was not only a great cook but a lovely lady. What I didnt like was even though we had booked the room five months prior, that we were given a disabled room because it was the only one available which meant that we used only one of the bathrooms.Being a light sleeper having a room facing the the courtyard area, there was a lot of noise from what I think was the airconditionig that seemed louder than any other place we had stayed. Its location is good for shopping in Beverly Hills, everything is just a short cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant manager - terrible customer service - stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Padinphx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is below average despite there claims of a refurbishment. Gym is tiny and has a strange smell. The "manager" Robby, is possibly the rudest Marriott employee I have ever come across, extremely arrogant and unhelpful when I questioned charges to my bill, and contradicted everything his staff had told me, and then said "well we did give you a free upgrade" - that was not out of the goodness of your heart Robby, that is because I have stayed 38 nights at Marriott hotels in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Occurrence”
Reviews.Author: dinobosco
Reviews.Content: Overall my experience with the hotel was excellant except for one strange happening. The first night we stayed at the hotel we had brought with us a bottle of Cabernet. We ordered a delivery of food for dinner and ate in the room. This of course entailed many plastic containers and bags, which we threw in the trash when we were done. We drank about 2/3rds of the wine and put the rest in the fridge. I also drank most of a bottle of Sprite and put what was left in the fridge also. The next morning we ate breakfast at the hotel. which was included and very good. We went back to the room and put the do not service magnetic sign on the outside of the door and went out for the day. When we returned around 4:30 pm I went to the fridge to have a drink of the sprite and noticed the wine and sprite were gone. Next I went to the trash to throw away a few items we had used that day in our travels and the trash was emptied. I called the front desk and they told me they would check the key card record to see who had entered the room. Turns out they say there were just three entries that day, two during breakfast and one when we got back to the room. I didn't know what to say because I know we left the wine and sprite in the fridge and we certainly didn't empty the trash. Later that evening we noticed that the card with television stations on it we had used the night before was missing so we couldn't look up the channels we wanted. One last thing, my wife had doodled on the not pad in the room and that was missing too. The bed was not made up and no other changes were observed. The front desk said they would check with the head of housekeeping, but we haven't heard anything from them. The only thing I can guess is that maybe we didn't close the door all the way and a maid started cleaning the room before she noticed the do not service sign on the door that was propped open. The wine was no big deal, but it should not have been taken. Also, they made me feel as if I was lying or something. I didn't demand anything, I just wanted to know what happened. The air conditioning stays on and off too long so the room was either too hot or too cold. I finally found a window that opened partially and turned on the fan at night the second evening which allowed us to sleep much better. Other then this incident the staff was courteous and the room is nicely priced for the location. There's a Deli right across the street with authentic Jewish food and full of all kinds of sports memorabilia that I encourage everyone to visit. It was awsome.

Reviews.Title: “If you're traveling with a pet stay at the Palmora”
Reviews.Author: sluing
Reviews.Content: This hotel is noisy and while pet friendly charges a lot for nothing in return. The Palmora is nicer and doesn't charge you for the dog and even provides a dog bed and bowls. It is much much quieter but doesn't have the kitchenette. My dishwasher was broken only some of the the laundry machines work making waits excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for families visiting West LA”
Reviews.Author: bronzeroof
Reviews.Content: This was a good deal for a suite to fit four of us in one room so close to Beverly Hills and right next to Factor's famous deli and a gas station (use AA discount if you can). Good free breakfast with omelettes, cereal, bagels and waffles. Bedrooms a bit small, but ample common room with fridge and kitchenette. Adequate fitness room and good valets. The major complaint was that my wife and I didn't sleep great because the bed was firmer than we are used to. Kids had no problem. If not for that, this would have been a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great to be Back”
Reviews.Author: BobbyGAus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Aug. last year for 8 nights. This time was only 5 as we planned some extra travel. Since then the Hotel has had a makeover, and a great job it is too! Much brighter, with larger breakfast facilities and loads of colour. It was fantastic to catch up with Keenan, Michelle and Becky (love the hair!) Everything was spot on! If only it was a bit closer than a 13.5hr flight from Australia!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Residence Inn, conveniently located, GREAT staff”
Reviews.Author: dczerkle
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just wrapped up a week long business/leisure trip. This is not a typical Residence Inn, this is much more upscale with touches such as a free breakfast omelette station and valet parking. The price was right, the rooms very comfortable, good sound insulation, and nice Marriott beds. The kitchen area was certainly a plus. This hotel is conveniently located to Beverly Hills shopping (you can walk to Rodeo Drive) and restaurants (ate at Mr. Chow, Spago and Urth Caffe, Sprinkles and brought leftovers back to room for extra meals.). Location was convenient for driving downtown (take Pico when freeways are congested) downtown Hollywood, and Santa Monica/Malibu area. Disneyland commute was a bit frazzled, but we preferred staying in BH. Entire staff was very welcoming, hotel was very clean. I would definitely stay here again and will recommend to my family/friends.

Reviews.Title: “Well Treated at Central Location”
Reviews.Author: jt914
Reviews.Content: We were treated very well at this property. The room was perfect. My wife and i in one bedroom, my girls in the other and my son in the central living room on the pull-out. All had TVs although we did not use them much, thankfully. Staff was very pleasant and accomodating. Room was clean and housekeeping did a good job. Valets were polite and accomodating. We came in very late and the parking valet parked the car and took everything up for us. Breakfast was ample although the omlette station was not manned on the weekend (wife sad). Hot oatmeal, cereals, chafing dish items, etc. Pool was not much to speak of (small) and no laps can be swum. My two kids had fun but if two other kids had come by it would have been full. Location was very central and we got to everyplace we needed to go. Supermarket close and good restaurants (fish, SE Asian, Italian). Area is a bit commercial though so don't expect to go walking around at night.

Reviews.Title: “What I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: Psnpsn
Reviews.Content: Hotel hallways are oddly decorated, but who cares- the bathroom was roomy, the one bedroom was clean, the bed was comfortable. It's nice- not luxury but very practical. Staff was friendly. The valet car process can be off- putting if you aren't used to it- but i lived in an apartment complex in Chicago that had it so I get it. They were very good about it- ran it well- never had to wait for my car. Oh, and Beverly Hills is not that fancy place that Jethro lived in- looked like a typical neighborhood, although there are nice parts- this is located in a normal part. Factor's Deli across the street is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Had everything we needed in LA”
Reviews.Author: HawkMD
Reviews.Content: We spent Spring Break in LA and wanted to be somewhere central. The Residence Inn worked very well. The hotel is located near the Musuem of Tolerance and the Jewish area in LA. The area was very safe and I was able to take a few runs to see the mansions in Beverly Hills. The rooms were large and had a well appointed kitchen, which came in handy. Breakfast was plentiful with many different offerings such as waffles, yogurt, scrambled eggs, sausage, cereals, and oatmeal. They had made to order omelets, as well. They also have a managers reception Monday-Wednesday nights. the parking is $22/day if you self park, which was very easy. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone going to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Linschultz
Reviews.Content: We stayed on March 14, 2011 at the Residence Inn. We were warmly greeted and told about the afternoon happy hour which we enjoyed very much. Our room was perfect for our daughter having her own bedroom and bath. We could walk to Rodeo Drive. Eddie, the Concierage, was very helpful with arranging a tour and explaining the area to us. We recommended the hotel to my sister who is staying there this weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The manager must be doing something good here!”
Reviews.Author: rowdj
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, pulled into the garage and were immediately greeted by the valet attendant. The lobby looks great and felt very comforting. My husband went to the concierge desk to look for places around. The front desk clerk was very helpful, very pleasant and friendly, shame on me for not getting her name. I could tell that she enjoys her job and loves what she does. I mentioned that I like the look of the hotel and it is very friendly considering of the locations. She smiled and said "thank you, everyone loves working here". We went to our room and were surprised to see our room amenities. What a way to wow guests after a long drive. They must have found out it was our first time here. My husband and I had such a great time and would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical run of the mill Residence Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: billandrowena
Reviews.Content: I had read a few comments about this hotel undergoing some renovations and was expecting a standard upgrade to carpet and wall coverings. Boy was I wrong! Upon entering the lobby I felt as though I had entered a swank and hip boutique hotel somewhere in Santa Monica or Hollywood. After having a pleasant conversation at check-in with a more than cordial front desk agent and Ed, the bellman, my wife and I continued to our room and encountered several more decor upgrades. The hallways were a soothing blue and the rooms had all the amenities you could ask for. Free high speed internet! Need I say more. The breakfast in the morning was superb! We always stay at a Residence Inn on business and leisure travel because of the great deals and amazing breakfast. As a father of 4, it's all about saving a few bucks. This was my first time at this particular Residence Inn but my wife and I loved the convenient location. Centrally located between downtown LA, Hollywood and Santa Monica, it was easy for us to get around. I will absolutely recommend this hotel to family, friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “terrible management”
Reviews.Author: eileeno14
Reviews.Content: I had the unfortunate luck of having my company pick this hotel as our meetup for a recent business trip. I got room 118 and it seemed OK until about 5am the next morning when the stench of tater tots and grease woke me up along with the very loud sounds from the street. I called down to the front desk to complain about the smell and I was told that I was directly above the kitchen and that is why my room smelled. I asked to be moved and they said they had several rooms on a higher floor that would get me away from the smell and the noise from the street. I then asked why they didn't give me one of the rooms to begin with?? So at 530 am I had to pack up all of my clothes (which smelled like kitchen grease) and all of my belongings to be moved. I was then told by the employee that moved me that he would take care of the room on my bill. I assumed this meant he would comp me the night since I had to move in the middle of the night but later found out that they only gave me a $50 credit. That was fine but when I talked to the employee at the front desk I was told I could ask for 25,000 points on my Marriott Rewards card. They took my name and number and said the manager would call me the next day to talk to me. I never got a call from the manager and when I followed up with Customer Service they agreed that I should also get points credited to my Marriott Rewards Card. They passed along my complaint to the manager of the hotel who then decided to respond to my issues. He/she stated that since there are kitchens in the hotel some rooms may smell of food. This was not true in my case since once I went in the hallway there was no stench of kitchen grease, it was only in my room because of the venting from the kitchen. Next they told me that there were not many extra rooms because of the NBA All-Star game. I checked in on 2/14, the game was on 2/20 so that was obviously a lie. And then they said they could not give me a credit of Marriott Rewards Points unless I authorized them to charge my credit card $50. The manager was completely rude and should be ashamed of how they treat their customers. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone ever because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything except the parking situation”
Reviews.Author: cilneri
Reviews.Content: I came into town for a wedding of my cousin. We pulled up to the hotel and immediately was greeted by valet parking and was informed this was the only way to keep our car parked at the hotel. Not a big deal, I proceeded to check in. The lobby and 1st floor is very modern, lots of space and a very generous breakfast area. Staff is equally accommodating and happy to answer any questions. The rooms are a bit cramped (vs. other Residence Inns), but not very surprised. Breakfast situation is excellent, with the staff even bringing out items well past breakfast time. Beware of the parking of $20+/day including tax to keep your car at the hotel, no kidding! Besides that, terrific Residence Inn property!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem In Beverly Hills Shines Even Brighter Now”
Reviews.Author: JRacine690
Reviews.Content: Every time I travel to the Los Angeles/Beverly Hills area, I always stay at the Residence Inn Beverly Hills. Their staff are always friendly, accommodating and allowing pets makes it perfect for me. I am always impressed with the Residence Inn Beverly Hills, but let me tell you, my last visit blew me away! The hotel was recently renovated and the hotel just oozes style & sophistication with a casual elegance. The work done is incredibly impressive with a warm and welcoming lobby with a dining area where the complimentary breakfast is served. I was pleasantly surprised when at breakfast, a new omelet station was added where a custom omelet or egg creation is made to order. The guest rooms have some of best amenities including a great kitchen and dining area, super plush pillows and bedding as well as flat panel TV which can swivel to be seen on the couch, at the desk, in the kitchen or in bed. Add in the complimentary wireless internet and you practically never need to leave the hotel and go to Rodeo Drive, LA Live or any of the studios which are very close by. I love this hotel and cannot recommend it enough. You must stay here on your trip to Beverly Hills!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip!”
Reviews.Author: sftoneman84
Reviews.Content: The newly renovated rooms look amazing! And the free continental breakfast is wonderful for someone who is exploring the city! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gonie_stenly
Reviews.Content: it was a great hotel and so close to everywhere in beverly hiils. The staff was great and like the new look.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN.”
Reviews.Author: lilyson
Reviews.Content: Terrible. We found bugs and got bug bites, and it took 48 hours for the staff to find a solution. We were sent away three times, and when we finally reached a supervisor she was informed of the problem and had done nothing to solve it. Only when we brought the bug to the front desk did they spring into action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to make you feel at home in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Content: I would recommend to anyone needing an extended stay in the area

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay but parking gripes”
Reviews.Author: RonboNJ
Reviews.Content: Those of you who have been following my multitude of Trip Advisor reviews on hotels I stay at while on business know that I prefer the Marriott Brand. When I have the chance to stay at a Residence Inn it's always icing on the cake. I love the oversized rooms with full kitchen, refrigerator and microwave. The Residence Inn at Beverly Hills seemed to be the perfect choice on my business trip to Los Angeles to do studio press coverage. It's located within walking distance to Fox studios which I found very convenient. The rooms here seem a tad smaller than most Residence Inn rooms I have stayed in, though there is still plenty of space. What is a little different is that instead of there being a separate bedroom and living room divided by wall and door, it is combined into one large room. In the center is a small desk that is perfect for computer work. The room comes with complimentary high-speed Internet access however the wired router in the room (#516) was broken. I didn't complain about it since the wireless access was pretty darn fast though it required you to login several times throughout the day instead of only once. The room itself is clean. The bed was immensely comfortable with a nice firm mattress, lots of pillows and extra blankets in the closet. Despite the fact the hotel is located on a busy street corner of the city I was never bothered by the traffic below and never heard any sounds from my neighbors. I slept very well. By the way, the rooms have a nice iHome clock radio for you to dock your iPhone or iPod touch. It was a real treat coming downstairs in the morning to a complimentary hot and cold breakfast that contained (on a rotational basis) eggs, sausage, biscuits with gravy, home potatoes, yogurt, cereals, waffles, muffins, bagels and english muffins. During select weekdays there is complimentary food and beer served in the restaurant. All this praising is met with one major gripe: the parking. It is valet and the price is exorbitant at $22 plus a $2.50 tax per night. First, it's very inconvenient not to be able to immediately access your vehicle. Also, at nearly $25 per night are you supposed to tip the valet drivers the multitude of times you need to retrieve your vehicle throughout the day? My God, this is a Marriott forcing you to pay a rate that should be half its price. I know there have been a lot of complaints expressed here on Trip Advisor. I know management is reading them. Suggestion: drop your valet parking to $12 per night. Stop gouging your guests. All the griping aside, I was very satisfied with my stay here. However, next time I am in town I might do a little more research for a hotel in this price range that doesn't gouge its guests on valet parking rates. Otherwise, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jerry7722
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Residence Inn Beverly Hills. Our party was comprised of my wife and son. We stayed in a 2-bedroom suite with 2 baths, living room and kitchen. The entire hotel was spotless. The beds were comfy and our suite was very quiet. We especially appreciated the large fridge. The staff was very proficient in their duties. All friendly and courteous. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “We received outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: mcs130
Reviews.Content: We have a family member that is in critical condition at Cedar's Hospital and the front desk went beyond expectations and service during our recent stay. Their kindness and caring were greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE TO STAY IN A VERY GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MikeTObaby
Reviews.Content: Their were many aspects of this hotel that made it one of the best we have stayed at so far. For example, the breakfast was unbeatable! They served omelettes to waffles, it was great. Luckily, during our stay we also were able to eat our dinners and wine/beer as well. The patio was outstanding which overlooked beverly and pico. My only flaw with this hotel was the sheets in the closets smelled horrible as if they werent washed for at least 6 months... as well as the sofa bed in bad shape. however, with some added sheets it made it okay. I had a King sized suite anyways, couldnt complain. The service was absolutely the best I have seen in a while. Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting beverly hills area and do not want to spend a fortune doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Location, value and service - this place can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: Altaskibum
Reviews.Content: I am a bit of creature of habit...I always stay at a Marriott (102 nights so far this year -ugh!). I stay at Marriotts because they are predictable, generally clean and convenient. I recently stayed 9 nights at the Beverly Hills Residence Inn followed by another 3 night stay. I also never write reviews about a Marriott hotel on tripadvisor, however, this hotel compelled me to change my ways. First of all, this hotel is a great value. You get a studio room with a small kitchenette all for less than $200 a night... in LA! There are not too many other hotels around (other than a dump) that offer that kind of pricing for what you get. Secondly this Residence Inn has all the typical qualities of a Residence Inn (free breakfast and internet) and more. When you check in there are a number of people on hand to help you...feels more like a regular Marriott. They also have a bellman...not typical for a Residence Inn and they have safes in every room...not even Marriott hotels have this amenity, and when you are staying for multiple nights it is a great thing to have. They also have a small bar that is open Monday to Friday and every Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday night they offer snacks, wine and beer. Unlike other Residence Inns they restock the snacks regularly over the snack hour so even if you arrive well after the start you can still get something to eat. Location wise the hotel is pretty central to most of LA. The area is quiet at night and there is a supermarket just up the street that is open from 6am to 1am daily. There are a couple of dry cleaners in easy walking distance and the hotel also has a Hertz desk if you want to rent a car for the day. The rooms are quite spacious and always clean. The layout is different from room to room. This building was originally a hospital so that explains the huge elevators and different rooms. Overall this is not only a great Residence Inn but a very good hotel. The only small gripe is that parking is valet only and $20 per day (the daily charge does decrease depending on the number of days you stay). The valets are very fast so you never have to wait for your car, however, paying for parking at a Residence Inn just seems wrong. In the hotel's defense, this is LA and every other hotel in the area charges for parking and a number much more than $20.00. If the hotel changed the fee to $10.00 per night I would think that would be reasonable for a Residence Inn. As I said...small gripe. The staff are great, the hotel is more than you would expect and location is central. As I said in the title...location, value and service - this place can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “An Enjoyable Stay.”
Reviews.Author: BobbyGAus
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the Residence Inn. We chose the hotel based on TAs reviewers. We were not disappointed. We did have a couple of slight problems, but they were quickly resolved by Keenan and Steven, so no harm was done to our enjoyment. The location was a big plus. Used the hotel shuttle to Rodeo Drv, The Beverly Centre, and Westfield Century City. Took the Metro bus to Santa Monica (stop across the road) and also to downtown LA (to see the Emmys). The included breakfast was good value. The hotel staff were ALL great, with Becky and Michelle the standouts. All in all a very enjoyable stay in LA, assisted by the folk at The Residence Inn. Made the 13hr trip from Australia worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay”
Reviews.Author: Alexander_Colorado
Reviews.Content: I spend about 50 nights a year in hotels, primarily on business, and this is one of my favorite hotels. It is a calm refuge in an otherwise very busy area. The staff is quite friendly. The hotel rooms are very "un-cookie-cutter"; each time I stay I get a room with a completely different layout. I use TripAdvisor, almost exclusively, for my pleasure trips, and this is my first time reviewing, so I hope this is helpful to those searching for a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cecilia
Reviews.Content: We are staying here now and so far it's as expected except for the coffee. It's awful. I tried both coffee machines and both were bad. Perhaps the hotel is trying to direct business to the expensive coffee shop next door. Maybe tomorrow we will make coffee in the room too see if that's better. I agree with previous comments about the poor placement of the air conditioning unit so near the lovely bed. Lying there with the air on makes it difficult to hear the tv. However, since I'm assigned to the hide-a-bed and brought earplugs along, the only noise I heard last night was from the noisy neighbors coming down the hall yelling and slamming doors at 2 am. I am staying here with my daughter. She is a repeat business customer and likes the location and kitchenette. So far we have only had to ask for sheets for the hide-a-bed and they came within 10 minutes. I've noticed that the staff has been great even when dealing with some difficult guests. I would prefer a self park.

Reviews.Title: “On a scale of 1 to 10, this is a Ten”
Reviews.Author: DennisMcGinness
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. We stayed in a studio with a kitchenette. A letter from the manager was attached to the refrigerator stating that he wanted our stay to be a 10. The room was tastefully appointed and everything was in working order. The bed was super comfortable, the bathroom was roomy and the shower was hot with plenty of water pressure. The living room area was roomy and comfortable with a big screen TV that swiveled to be viewed from the bed. There was complimentary full buffet breakfast daily that was always well managed and well attended The staff was friendly and efficient in all areas. We travel a lot and I consider it a great stay if the Hotel delivers as advertised and I never have to speak to management. I have found that the difference between one hotel and another is usually the management. This manager wanted our stay to be a10 and he and his staff delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....far from main attractions”
Reviews.Author: Luv_kitty_2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn by Marriott from Aug 7th-10th in Beverly Hills. The hotel is clean, rooms clean as well, and very quiet. One of the reasons we picked this hotel was because a full breakfast was included. That cut down on our eating costs a bit. To see Rodeo drive or a bit of the town, you had to walk a bit up the road (4 blocks) but it wasn't so bad considering it wasn't hot out for a summer day. The food is expensive in some areas, however we found a great sushi place for lunch that was plentiful for around $10.00. Shopping was expensive (on Rodeo drive) where all the stars shop of course! What was great about this hotel was it was a 5 minute walk to the Pavillion grocery store. We picked up some snacks, water and lunches for cheap. Free high speed internet, a fitness room and a spa pool were all included in the rate. The only thing that really bothered us was the parking is not free. It's about $22 a day plus tax! Since we needed a rental to drive to Las Vegas (second part of our trip) we had no other choice. We also drove to Santa Monica beach, Farmer's Market, Malibu beach and around Beverly Hills (all within 10 km. The views are immaculate however, I did not see one star!! I really liked this hotel although once you see all the main attractions, there is nothing left to do....we also spent a day at Santa Monica Pier (beach with rides etc). Lots to see and do....shopping there was ok was well. We had a wonderful time! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay At Beverly Drive”
Reviews.Author: sgavik
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a nice one, location is pretty good, 3 blocks away from Rodeo and the heart of Beverly Hills. Rooms are fine, but thought it could have been more elegant, have free internet all over the hotel, have nice all including complementary breakfast, free snacks and drinks provided from Monday to Wednesday. Also give a pick and drop service so i believe it take cares of all the needs, have a small pool at basement, but i would ideally love to have some open spaces inside the property, it is only the building right now and sometime have the feeling of being suffocated, Hotel should think of adding some extra space.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located - Good Service”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior365
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week - overall, good stay. Friendly staff, clean hotel. Good location - lots of restaurants and shopping within a 5-10 min drive. Clean rooms, good wifi - well stocked with amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: can37
Reviews.Content: We traveled through California for 10 days and stayed at Marriott's all but 2 nights. We stayed at the Beverly Hills Residence Inn for 1 night. It was in a nice area and we took the bus to Santa Monica Pier. The staff was very friendly helpful. The breakfast was good and served our needs perfectly. The bed in our room was very close to the air conditioning unit. At night it was difficult to get around. Overall we had great stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: hamad94
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for more than three weeks. The staff in the reception were great and helpful from the check in, giving direction to super market, resturants and even bus schedules. My teenage son enjoyed the excersice room and the free internet with the available computers in the reception. The available laundary room lets us feel as if we were at home. We as a family were happy from this hotel since they provide the comfort and clean service to the room. Definitly if I will visit Los Angeles I will stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure I'd Go Here Again”
Reviews.Author: CarpCaster
