Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Hotel was full. - Staff very friendly - Parking very expensive - valet only - $22 PLUS parking tax of 2.50. - Parking very tight. Entrance is under the building. Low clearance. - Valet staff did about as well as expected with the cramped parking area. - Room nice. - Nice lobby. - Pillows way too soft - all air - put your head on it and sink all the way to the mattress. - Free breakfast only so so. Some hot food. Small eating area. - Hotel is in a nice area. - Not inexpensive and when you add on $22 room tax, $22 parking, 2.50 parking tax, (that's almost $50 over room rate) you're in an expensive room. - I would try to find something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel if you want to stay around $200/night”
Reviews.Author: sbrita
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel if you want to keep your nightly rate around $200. The location is good and there are even a few places to walk to. Its far from the beach so if you want to be close to the water, this isn't the place. The rooms were clean yet on the small side for a suite. The kitchen was fully stocked and usable. The staff was friendly and helpful. This hotel does a lot of businesses. Rooms were not ready when I showed up around 1pm, so don't plan to check in early. Overall - great value.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for price”
Reviews.Author: Donna007_10
Reviews.Content: This is the best deal in the Beverly Hills area. My husband and I needed to be here for an art show. This staff is first class all the way, yet this is not a five star typical high end Beverly Hills hotel. The GM, Michael D'Amodio delivers a great product and the staff gets it done. Flat screen TV's, free wifi in the rooms, free breakfast and spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “It's QUIET! How rare in L.A.!”
Reviews.Author: BarefootTom
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property. Good rooms and if you are on the courtyard side, it is very quiet, which is such a rare commodity when staying in L.A. Yes, there is a security deposit on a debit card, but at least this hotel (unlike another I was just in on Sunset Blvd.) credits it back within hours of checkout. The staff is friendly (I had a long discussion with one of the valets about the L.A. Dodgers - it's so refreshingly rare for people to take the time in L.A. to actually talk to you) Breakfast was very good and free. In short, this is my hotel of choice next time out to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value”
Reviews.Author: pickles44
Reviews.Content: The lobby and gatehouse are well appointed and cared for. The staff looks you in the eye and greets you by name. The free internet and breakfast is outstanding. Everyone here makes me feel like they appreciate me staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: SMStew
Reviews.Content: My travel party included 2 moms and 2 teenagers. We wanted a 2 bedroom suite in a great location and we found it here. Our suite included 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a full kitchen. We shopped for groceries at Ralph's, which is very close by. Breakfast was great with lots of variety. This location was perfect for us and was centrally located between Santa Monica and all the other sight-seeing we planned in and around Hollywood, Burbank, shopping in Beverly Hills, etc. We were all able to use the laundry room to wash clothes mid-way during our vacation. The staff was attentive to requests for extra hangers, etc. We never had to wait for our car with the valet parking and the parking staff was very accomodating. This hotel and location worked out perfectly for us and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for families”
Reviews.Author: flanar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location. The room we stayed was a two bedrooms, with two bath and a bed sofa in the living area. All rooms have a small complete kitchen what is very convenient for those nights when we arrive so tired that the best to do is to eat something there. There is a supermarket one block from there. The complimentary breakfast is excelent, they prepare eggs individually for those who want it, there are fruits, etc... Every day, we asked the staff for directions to drive to the place we want to go and they gave us a printed map with the directions specifically for the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: kyean
Reviews.Content: We like the 2 bedrooms with 2 bathrooms, and a living/kitchenette. Firm beddings but double beds slightly squeezy for my 2 teenage boys. Spacious living area with flat screen TV. Even the 2 bedrooms have flat screen TVs. Good laundry machine at the basement. However, breakfast was horrible experience. Plastic cutleries is definitely unbecoming of a 4 star American hotel brand. Breakfast very limited and ran out quickly. Lousy coffee more like dish water. Better off not drinking it at all.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I'll stay when I come back to LA from now on.”
Reviews.Author: thetekin
Reviews.Content: The location was central to exploring the city and it's surroundings. The staff is detail oriented to cleanliness and assistance, without ever being overbearing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, even greater location”
Reviews.Author: jolorenzo
Reviews.Content: All the comforts of home when you're out on the road. If you're visiting L.A., it's prime location makes it accessible to the coast, the mountains, and the hot spots of Beverly Hills and Hollywood. I can't recommend this location enough. Staff is warm and courteous. This is the place to stay, short term or for an extended vacation. We had a beautiful two bedroom suite with all the amenities of home- full kitchen, living room, giant tvs in all the rooms, high speed internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussie_traveler_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at $119 per night. Great rate if you can get it. At this price the hotel is a bargain as it includes breakfast. The room we had was a 1 bedroom, with plenty of room. The bed was very nice, but the sofa bed was not very nice. We had to put the mattress on the floor. No big deal. The valet parking at $20 per day was fast and efficient. The breakfast was typical average selection, but adequate. No complaints. The hotels location is great and walking distance to some great attractions. Yes would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hospitality that I experienced at this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: letshavefuneb
Reviews.Content: The entire Hotel was very clean and I loved the location, It was pretty central to everything and I could even walk to a major grocery store. It was the most comfortable Hotel I have stayed in and the staff were all very helpful from the person that would get my car to the front desk employees. They actually treated you like a friend instead of a guest. I will definitely tell my friends and family about the great hospitality that I felt!

Reviews.Title: “Agreed - great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LALynnie
Reviews.Content: Just concluded my 2nd stay at this hotel and it's a terrific choice if it fits your needs and plans. I spent 20 years living 5 blocks from the hotel before moving east, so I wanted the convenience and familiarity of my old 'hood. Since it was a 4-night stay, I passed on the fancier places in the area (Century Plaza, Bev Hilton, etc.) where I'd have to cope with much smaller rooms and lots of tourists. This hotel does it right. While the room wasn't plush, it was clean, contemporary, functional (a pleasure, since I'd just been at a hotel where nothing worked), easy free internet access, well-stocked and spacious with living room and kitchen/desk areas. They honored my specific advance room request upon check-in, handled a minor problem promptly. The staff is lovely, particularly all the guys in the garage, and the entire place is managed very well. It's very convenient to the Westside. A few points/thoughts: --Yes, $22/day parking for in/out privileges is expensive in broader sense, but not only is that standard in LA at hotels, a friend stayed at the nearby Intercontinental Century City and paid about $35/day. The garage staff moved fast, brought up/took away cars quickly and was very helpful with packages (and with me, since I caught a bad cold and was barely moving at one point). --The free breakfast can be a zoo. I wound up hitting the market nearby and making coffee and bagels in my room, thanks to the coffee pot and fridge. There's a huge Ralphs supermarket a block away (that property also has a giant CVS, a few other shops and restaurants). Factor's, one of LA's most popular delis, is a block in the other direction. Area's very safe to walk around, even at night. --While the hotel isn't near any tourist sites, no hotel in the town really is. It's LA: there's little opportunity to walk to your destinations, since they can range from Hollywood to Santa Monica. Cabs are also very expensive and scarce: rates are high, it could be 20 miles to your destination and it's not a town where you can simply flag a cab, which means keeping a cab phone number on hand and being willing to wait. Either rent a car or if you're unwilling to drive the freeways or have only occasional travel needs, arrange 1/2 or full-day driver service. This doesn't have to be done through the costly limo companies; many cab companies offer day rates.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BigMetsFan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Marriott Residence Inn in Beverly Hills many times, as my wife and stay there whenever we visit our child in LA. I keep coming back year after year because the hotel is so well run, so clean and so concerned about it's guests. The rooms are kept up-to-date, with comfortable beds and flat screen TVs and they offer free internet and a free buffet breakfast. The management is very very concerned about the guests and it shows in the behavior of the staff. I would recommend this hotel as a great place to stay and you can be assured of a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal, with great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaPlanner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night passing through L.A. The hotel is decently located, though not actually in Beverly HIlls (adjacent to it). It's close to markets, coffee shops, etc. We had a queen suite with a kitchen and great view of the city; the bed was comfortable but oddly located right next to a vent (though that didn't cause any problems). The room was large and had a big TV with lots of good cable channels. The hotel offered free snacks in the late afternoon and a great free breakfast (my husband, who's very into hotel breakfasts, raved that it was the best he'd ever seen in a hotel--omelets made to order, sausage patties, waffle maker, big and mini waffles, and the usual fruit, cereals, yogurts, English muffins, potatoes, etc.). The only thing we didn't like about this hotel was the $22 parking fee, which we avoided by parking in the surrounding neighborhood. Definitely recommended, especially if you get it cheaply on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, deceiving location - but well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: StuckOnThe50
Reviews.Content: Looking to close to Universal Studios and decided to play a little with Priceline for the Beverly Hills area. Put in a low price for a 3* Hotel not expecting to get it and we got this hotel for $57/night via Priceline. Was excited as it said Beverly Hills but this must be at the edge of Beverly Hills. This area is not exactly a place you would take a stroll in the evening. Close to UCLA on the way to the 405. At the end of the day once you get into the hotel its like any other Residence Inn. Got a Queen bed with sofabed pull out for the kids. Kitchen, free internet, free breakfast and newspaper like normal. Altough we stayed only one night at this hotel, it like any other Residence Inn I have stayed at only its the tallest one (8 stories). Only negative is the $22 parking but it LA and you have to expect it.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds!”
Reviews.Author: yam1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 3 blocks away from Rodeo drive, so it is a nice walking distance. We booked a tour, and the drop off location was Farmers Market, about 3.5 miles from the hotel. We did not want to use our car during the day in LA, as parking and traffic get really bad. So the hotel shuttle dropped us off at the Farmers Market (ask for Guillermo at the valet, he is very helpful). It is nice to get to the marker a little bit earlier then the tour start time. We walked around, did window shopping. Since it was around Christmas time, the area was really beautiful. After the tour was over, were dropped off at the same location. From there you can take bus number 217, it will take you all the way to Hollywood Boulevard ($1.25 one way, be prepared to have exact changes, these buses do not give change). From Hollywood Boulevard we took 217 again and then switched to bus 4 at Santa Monica Boulevard. That bus took us to Crescent stop, which is a 1 1/2 block from Rodeo Drive. We found taking buses much easier then driving in LA, although there are some weird people who ride those buses, so keep your belongings close. The hotel does offfer ccomplimentary breakfast, as all Residence Inns do. Sat/Sun morning there were quite a number of people, but you can sit inside, in the lobby and outside. Parking is $24, expensive, but is it LA. Beds are the best of course, like with any Marriott. The hotel does not have a restaurant on property, but there have the menus of some restaurants in the area that will deliver right to your guest suite. We found it very convenient; after sitting in LA traffic for 4 hours, it was very pleasant to have the food delivered. Order from Famours Farmers (I think this is what they are called); excellent food, and you can actually charge to the guest room or pay cash, No pool, just jacuzzi, but a big one; and a fitness center. Staff was pleasant. The room was had was quite small, studio with a queen bed and a sofa sleeper. Once you open up the sofa sleeper, not so much space in the room. But when you are visting for signtseeing, we did not really stay in the room much, so it was OKey. Overall, nice hotel, good location. Heading back home you get right on I-10 (about 1.5 miles from the hotel), the freeway will take you anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for all the fun tourist things to do around Beverly Hills and Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: moneyminder
Reviews.Content: This was a great value for a very large studio room with full kitchen, a pillow top bed, large flat screen tv and even a view of the LA city lights from our top floor corner room. We paid about $122 per night which was a great rate for this area. Free breakfast included cooked to order omelets, scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles and all the other usual breakfast items. We used this as our base to visit Santa Monica pier (15 minutes away), Paramount Studios and Farmers Market (about 20 minutes) Rodeo Drive (10 minutes) and Graystone Mansion (10 minutes). Valet parking is the only parking option at $22 per night but it is super quick and convenient with easy in and out to surface streets. Staff was friendly and helpful with quick check in. Our top floor room was well insulated from the surrounding surface street traffic noise. An excellent choice if you want a nice large room but don't need the glitz of a high end Beverly Hills hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: samk23
Reviews.Content: the hotel was great wih me because i didn't know where to go and they were very nice and informative. The room was a good size and very clean. It's in a great location close to Hollywood. You are greeted with smaile when you arrive till you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Staff! Front Desk Young Woman Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: annereed
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in perfect location to travel all around Beverly Hills, West Hollywood, etc. Very nice staff, but most friendly and helpful was wonderful young woman at front desk who made great restaurant recommendations, and followed through with reservations and maps to them. I want to say her name was Kelly, but that may not be correct. We arrived on Nov. 2nd and checked out Nov. 3rd. Really great free breakfast. Anne Reed

Reviews.Title: “It's ok...”
Reviews.Author: Pharmrep79
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location in the city, but it is merely ok to me. The rooms are kinda smallish, but they are pretty nice. They have nice LCD type TV's, and a nice little kitchen. They are pretty small, however, for this kinda hotel. But, compared to an average hotel room they are pretty big. I got a really good rate on this one, but they only have valet parking, just so you know before you go. It is pretty nice overall, and I suggest that you eat at Tuk Tuk down the street for some casual thai food.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff”
Reviews.Author: rubbiecat
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom suite here and it was fine. Floorplan was a bit strange - space could have been planned better. Very large full kitchen that I doubt most guests need, and tiny bath vanity, maybe 30" wide, outside the tub/toilet room - kind of crammed in front of the closet. Bed was comfortable, but not much room to walk around the bed. There was a real wall separating the bedroom so it could be closed off. Hotel staff all very good - front desk, bellman and valet. Valet fee $22 was high, but I think the norm in the area. I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: walshgu
Reviews.Content: In October of 2009 I flew out to Los Angeles with my girlfriend as we were both interviewing for jobs out there (we're New Yorkers). We decided to stay in Beverly Hills as the hotel was equidistant from our two office locations (downtown and Santa Monica). We rented a car at the airport (we were unaware that the hotel had a Hertz located in the parking garage) and found the hotel quite easily. After parking the car ($22/day), we were greeted by a gentleman at the front desk who quickly got us checked in and even recommended an excellent lunch spot. When we got to the room, we found it very neat and clean. It had a nice open a kitchen area, a comfortable couch, good queen-sized bed and a large flat screen tv on a swivel so it could be watched from the couch and the bed. The bathroom and vanity area were also quite nice and left us with no complaints. One strong positive of the hotel is that it has free internet, and although I found it a bit slow at times, it was not a deterrence to the work I had to complete. The location of the hotel was very convenient. It's only about a 10 minute walk from Rodeo Drive and for those that need it, there is a taxi stand right outside of the hotel on South Beverly Drive. A drawback of the hotel is that there is no restaurant where you can grab a quick meal. All the hotel offered, food wise, was a limited breakfast buffet which ended at 9:30am, even on the weekends. Overall though, the hotel was great for my needs and was an excellent value at ~$150/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge room, needs a bit of updating...”
Reviews.Author: Brenda111
Reviews.Content: This Marriot-owned hotel is a five minute drive from Rodeo Drive and all the posh shops. It is a little gloomy inside but the room we had was huge with a fully fitted kitchen, sofa, office-style desk, big TV and loads of space. Bathroom and bed fine, all clean but a lick of paint and spruce-up would do no harm. It's very good value (we pre-booked) and the only downside is expensive valet parking but that's par for the course in a city like LA. Mind you, the valet service was excellent, in an underground car park, you called down when you wanted the car and in about two minutes it was there. Worth it just for not having to go around trying to find it in the car park. The area itself is a bit shabby but once you drive a few hundred yards you get near the glitzy parts. There's a great deli across the road, recommend not eating in the restautant and going there for breakfast as there didn't seem to be much on offer in the hotel. A good choice for a few days in LA!

Reviews.Title: “A pure example of comfort and satisfaction!”
Reviews.Author: sftoneman
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! I am planning my next trip to Los Angeles and would not stay anywhere else! Thank you Marriott

Reviews.Title: “Good value - great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Toldnaes
Reviews.Content: Good deals - and great rooms with plenty of space and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not So great”
Reviews.Author: main3432432
Reviews.Content: Hotel: OK but not so great. They will put you in a middle of pet rooms. So, We can hear nice dog barking noises during nights. Car Rental: I rented couple of times in this Hertz rental facility. There are couple of louse people working this facility. I would say this 3rd grade Hertz location. I would suggest don't rent in this facility. There couple of rental companies with in one mile radius.

Reviews.Title: “Not in the heart of 90210, but close enough”
Reviews.Author: rockland_ta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn Beverly Hills for 2 days on a week and half trip through California. We got a great pre-paid rate for your typical Residence Inn room, small kitchen, living room and small bedroom. For what we needed, this hotel was great. Free breakfast, nice enough rooms, close enough to what we wanted to see, Beverly Hills, Hollywood Blvd, Hollywood Hills, etc. The only "bad" thing was having to pay $22/night for parking. But that's what happens when you stay in city hotel. One pleasant surprise was the lobby bar, which supposedly is the only one in any Residence Inn's. It's only open in the evening until 10:30, but nice enough to meet someone for an after dinner drink or 2.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a good location for local attractions and very roomy.”
Reviews.Author: mason14
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, great breakfast for free and rooms are nice and roomy. the only downside to this hotel is the beds! they are so hard!!! my husband had to sleep on the couch some because his back hurt so bad and we just could not rest very well. everything else was great just take a mattress pad!

Reviews.Title: “Pride”
Reviews.Author: HOTELBOBBY
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my annual trip to Los Angeles / West Hollywood for their Pride Weekend. I usually stay downtown but chose the Residence Inn for its central location to all our activities. Much to my joy I was greeted by an amazing staff of friendly and caring people who took interest in my comfort. I had a spacious 1 bedroom suite, with 2 bathrooms, stocked full kitchen, 2 wide screen TV's and a large living room. I felt like I was in my own apartment. Breakfast was included each day and the Internet was free. All this for the cost of a regular hotel room at the big brand hotels. What else did I need, nothing. When ever I go to the Los Angeles, Beverly Hills, or West Hollywood area this is my new home. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel...Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: LilLou25
Reviews.Content: This hotel might be more attractive to business customers, but I recently stayed here with friends on our trip to LA, and really liked it. Our original room wasn't prepared for our arrival, but they literally moved us to another straight away with no problems at all. The staff are all really friendly, and their is the valet parking there too. You do have to pay for this, and be warned they charge it straight to the credit card you leave for security purposes. Rooms are really big though, and ample space, the kitchen is well equipped and although it's on a main road, you hear hardly any traffic noise. The free internet in the rooms if you take your laptop is a real bonus too! Complimentary breakfast was nice, a good selection. Please note though, that you will need a car to travel about the city!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, Service-oriented staff. All good except for pricey parking”
Reviews.Author: chiliapple
Reviews.Content: Rooms are tight, and dated compared to other Residence Inns we have stayed at. No King beds, just Queen. Stayed at a courtyard-facing room, very quiet. Rooms, linens, are kept clean and everything is in good working order. Bathroom and Kitchen amenities are complete, with complimentary "Wolfgang Puck Coffee" and microwave popcorn daily. We did not cook meals but the full size refrigerator, microwave, and tableware were useful during our stay. Breakfasts were okay but in my opinion lacked healthier options,and there were no variations made on a daily basis, so if you stay for 6 nights, like we did.....expect to be served the same things every day. The exercise room in the basement was quite impressive, with several newish cardio machines for use. We used the 24-hour guest laundry room once during our stay -- glad they had it. Front desk staff were helpful and efficient (we had several parcels delvered to the hotel from our online shopping, and they received and kept them safe even between stays). Had a problem with the internet connection once and the technical staff that was sent up to the room was very polite, helpful, and skillful (whatever it is he did, it worked and he fixed the problem). My only complaint was the daily valet parking fees..... $22 daily plus 10% tax... almost $25 daily. Other than that, we found everything satisfactory and will most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not more than ok”
Reviews.Author: Pluttan
Reviews.Content: Was visiting Recidence Inn Beverly Hills during a world around trip. We think the hotel is okey, nothing more than that. Oure room was very cheap and ok fore the money. The service unfortenately was not so good and helpfully that we expected, but fore the price we paied it was ok. The cleaning was also okey. The cleaning boy cleaned the bathroom and the bed but not the rest of the room. The breakfast was very good....we loved it!! Nothing to complain about. The situation is good if you have a car. We was trying to find a nice restaurant near the hotel by food. We only find a scary little restaurant. The food was good but a scary place. We paied 90 US a night. ThatÂ´s cheap!! If you rent a car...this place is very valuable with nice breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beachlovingboy
Reviews.Content: I am a Gold Elite member with Marriott, and travel quite a bit. The service received at the Residence Inn Beverly Hills was superb! Everyone from the reception area, to the breakfast and valet were polite, cordial and extremely helpful! The room I was in was very clean, quiet and plenty of room. Almost too much room for one person! The hershey's chocolate at check in- being Gold- was a nice little touch. I will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Experience at the Residence Inn, Beverly Hills!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Silverjoey09
Reviews.Content: I took a short vacation in Los Angeles last week and had a great time. What made the time so great was where I stayed, The Residence Inn, Beverly Hills. I have stayed at many hotels in my time but this was one of the most professional, clean, warm and friendly hotels yet that I have ever experienced. It was great. As wel as the hotel being spotless, all employees have full kowledge of their jobs and are more than happy to help you in any way they can. By the time I left, I felt as though I had made friends with the staff. Such a warm and welcoming experience. In addition, The General Manager, Michael, was out and about greeting people and making sure to stop and check in with the customers to make sure all was good by them. I have never seen a General Manager present ever in any hotel. They usually sit in their ivory towers. Not this gent, he was available if you need him and oh so pleasant. This ws one of the best experiences I have had in a hotel in a very long time. Thanks! I will be back!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Return Guest is Always Pleased with Stay at Residence Inn Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: ubstrong1
Reviews.Content: I have been a repeat guest at the Residence Inn Beverly Hills for several years now. I am consistently very pleased with the attentive and courteous staff, cleanliness of the rooms, and overall fine service offered by the hotel. My request for a room facing the quiet, inner side of the building is always honored, and I get a great nightâ€™s sleep on the comfortable bedding- what a delight! The kitchen is well equipped (particularly useful for an extended stay), internet service is free, the location is convenient, and the rates are reasonable. The hotel is extremely well run by a general manager who is personable and truly cares about guest satisfaction. The staff follows his example, making it a happy situation for the guest!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Personalized Service does exist!”
Reviews.Author: MrsPillow
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! My experience was fantastic! The front desk was warm and inviting and when I wanted a specific room, they did some magic and got me exactly what I wanted. I was so impressed! Sometimes (always) in Beverly Hills, you pay through the nose, I found this hotel to be reasonable and beautiful! The decor was great, and the complementary breakfast was great. It had hot and cold items and healthy treats too. I travel all the time and this property gets my vote for my next trip. Great location, I felt safe as a single woman traveler and truly, the extra bit of attention I got from the entire staff (including housekeeping...thanks for the extra towels!) was great!

Reviews.Title: “Always the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: wgonzalez
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Beverly Hills Marriott more nights than my own home this year and I am always beyond pleased with the SERVICE, CLEANLINES and just overall QUALITY of this hotel. My business takes me to the Los Angeles area once a week and I have the choice to stay in any hotel but I continue to go back to the Beverly Hills Marriott not only because of the convenient and great location but because it is so clean the most like my home. I am a perfectionist and neat freak and this hotel is perfect for me. I have probably stayed in every room at the hotel and never once have I been disappointed in the care that is taken in keeping the rooms clean and comfortable. I recommend this hotel to all of my friends and business associates! Sincerely WG

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel - Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: SteakSnob
Reviews.Content: Residence Inns are typically a reliable chain of business hotels ran by Marriott. Known for their large refrigerators and oversized rooms - a business traveler's best friend can be these types of hotels. This Residence Inn in Los Angeles - right on the border of Beverly Hills - is an old hospital that was converted into a hotel. You will notice that the hot tub is actually an old physical therapy pool and it is two levels underground. While it is open 24 hrs a day, unless you like relaxing in a dungeon type of environment, it is not an ideal set up. There is a gym underground as well. Only one of the elevators actually goes down to the gym and hot tub so you have a guessing game to play because you cannot query the elevator when you want to go down. Parking at the hotel - Don't even bother. Residence Inns are typically known for the complimentary parking - and while this is in LA and it is very difficult to park on the street without getting ticketed. The valet staff will tell you they do not allow self park - which in fact the hotel does if you ask. A separate company runs the valet parking and they are an abrasive group of people. The first week we were at the hotel we parked here but quickly learned it was too much of a hassle to deal with the valet staff. Park across the street at the Crowne Plaza - it is cheaper and the parking attendants are much more friendly. Breakfast at this Residence Inn is very good - excellent help staff and wonderful cooks. In fact if the rest of the employees at the hotel were as good as the maids and breakfast staff, this would be an exceptional hotel even with the awkward hospital layout. Dinners are not near as good as the breakfasts, for the days they serve them and you may as well skip them all together. Finally, we had some minor damage that was done to our rental car by one of the valet staff when we were at the hotel. When we asked to talk to a supervisor, it seemed like he was never available. Finally we were told to fill out a claim form, noting the damage and the incident. The next day after we filed the report - once again asking for the supervisor - one of the valets produced a parking stubb that had written on it the exact damage that we reported in the incident report. He then claimed he saw us do the damage to the car and it was our fault. The time and date he said when he witnessed the incident was a time neither the car or any of us were at the hotel. As a frequent business traveler - this is by far one of the most bizarre and unimaginable situations ever experienced. Appealing to the Residence Inn Manager did no good either. This hotel, due to the unconventional layout and rather coarse management style, is probably the reason the rooms are heavily discounted on deal sites like Priceline. We would recommend avoiding this hotel until both the management and valet company have been removed and replaced with more typical friendly Marriott Residence Inn folks that we're use to dealing with.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: GEOFFS3
Reviews.Content: I booked this property because I had a free night certificate I had to burn up......But I must say that it met my expectations right on and I'd return if I was in the area. The location is pretty good if you are looking to explore the LA area. It's central to pretty much anywhere you'd want to go, however the traffic is another story ;-) This hotel is not exactly in Bev. Hills. It's about a mile walk to the main shopping area. I believe the hotel shuttle will take you three miles, although I never tried it. West Hollywood, Hollywood, Century City, Santa Monica, etc are all fairly close. However, what your GPS says is 3 or 4 miles can turn into 30 with the crazy traffic around there. There is a very nice Ralph's grocery store across the street, and quite a few eating establishments (this is a big Jewish area) withing walking distance. They aren't the touristy-LA kind of places so def. affordable. The actual hotel is very nice and fairly new. The staff were all very professional and attentive. Exactly what I would expect for a Marriott property. I had a studio suite. It's not all that large - basically a hotel room with a small kitchen thrown in. It's comfortable and clean and the bedding is great. There was a pullout couch that also served as a second bed. The free breakfast was quite extensive and featured lots of hot items. I was impressed. My main complant is that it cost $22/night for parking, although it was for valet. No self parking was available. If I had not been tired and been more aggressive, I think I could have easily found free street parking. But I was like screw it. Sometimes you choose your battles carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Residence Inn Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: Rallen1023
Reviews.Content: My partner and I needed a getaway and I was pleasantly surprised when my Priceline bid was accepted by the Residence Inn Beverly Hills. This is a gem of a hotel. Our room was a junior suite with kitchenette, living area and queen size bed. The room was very comfortable and had a 37 inch flat screen TV. The kitchenette had a full size refrigerator, microwave oven, etc. I have stayed at other Residence Inn hotels, but this one really stands out as my favorite. The staff was really friendly and helpful at check-in and throughout our stay. They have a great breakfast buffet that is free! The restaurant area also has an outdoor seating area that is perfect for enjoying sunny days. The hotel has a charming, sitting area off the lobby and even has an indoor pool! Valet parking is available. There are a number of restaurants and stores nearby. The hotel is close to shopping in Downtown Beverly Hills as well as Century City. I would definitely stay here again and also recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Fraz_LA
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much. The house was getting fumigated so we looked for somewhere nearby. The staff were great, loved the breakfast buffet, and the room was perfect. Stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed every minute. Will go there again next fumigation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for business”
Reviews.Author: MaKuMD
Reviews.Content: Good business location. A $15-20 cab ride to the Standard and the Viper Room. A $5 cab to Rodeo drive. Minor street noise during rush hour as people like to honk at the nearby intersection. At nights, Beverly Hills get pretty quiet so you don't get any street noise after this. Free coffee 24/7, great breakfast (includes omelette bar), evening wine reception (5-7pm), parking is $22 per night (valet only but they are really quick), hot tub open past posted time, decent gym, free Wifi. Overall, if you can get this place for less than $150, it's worth it, as it's a decent 3-star property.

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ken240
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at $70 a nite via Priceline, the parking costs about $25 a day, no complain. Great location easy to find. The staff was friendly. The complementary hot breakfast was very good too, but the coffee was so-so. I highly recommend this hotel. The all suite design allows you to cook your own stuff in-room. The reason I said "near perfect" was because there was a guest made microwave popcorn at 4am and triggered the fire alarm, so everyone in the hotel woke up and wanna find out what's happening. That means their alarm system is functioning the way it's designed.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: dkudu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week due to an operation at Cedars Sinai. This hotel is convenient, the staff very helpful and attentive--lots of smiles. Breakfasts were excellent with some variation each day--including an omelet cook one day. Monday-Thursday there were evening snacks with wine/beer/sodas. Comfortable beds, kitchenetts well equiped for light meals. Guest laundry facilities also available. Good internet connections. Nice discount for Cedars patients. Only down side is daily cost for parking + valet tips. This is run under contract to another company that covers most if not all of Beverly Hills...but valet parking is the norm for this general area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: flyguy39
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel in the past mostly due to the location and proximity to where I'm doing business. However there are a few things to note. The front desk staff while they are friendly and accomodating do a quick 180 if a phone call comes in and then you're second in line, wihch is annoying. The rooms are OK, but can use some renovating. My room had some cosmetic issues, like broken tiles in the bath and kitchen. the One bedroom suite has the queen bed crammed into a very small space. In addition I had one of the interior rooms. While it is quiet, you get absolutely no sun or sky view at all. What you do get is an alley view and another room directly across from your window. Not much to write home about. The couch has had better days; the cushions were shot. The person or persons who designed this building with the rooms situated as mine is obviously didn't care about what guests would want or desire. In addition note that valet parking is all this place has and at $22/night its kind of a ripoff. But there really is no other choice unless you want to try street parking and risk getting towed. As said earlier the rooms could use a renovation. In addition the A/C is very loud as is the refridgerator. Both seem to be on constantly. Not very environmentally friendly. The hotel maids are anything but quiet during the day. One afternoon I was working in the room and all I could hear was one mail screaming something in Spanish to another. What about the people who are sleeping during the day? I bet those maids wouldn't appreciate someone yelling outside their door while they are sleeping or working, no? One more complaint and then I'll stop. The hot and cold water do not mix well when taking a shower. Its either scalding hot or cold, no inbetween. I'm not sure what thats all about, but at $233/night it would be nice to get something inbetween, no? Thats all. I'll end with this is probably the last time I'll stay here. Its time to find a hotel in Beverly Hills that actally lives up to the Beverly Hills name!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine accomodation without the frills”
Reviews.Author: alantm
Reviews.Content: This is a case of choosing the hotel more for it's location than for being the best place to stay for the price. That said, I can't find much to fault the hotel with for my stay. The room was very clean, the bed comfortable, the kitchenette a welcome place to throw some things in the refrigerator, the LCD tv a nice touch and the free wi-fi useful. Breakfast was serviceable in that free-hotel sort of way, even despite summer vacation kids always fighting to make their own waffles. The valet crew deserves a tip of the hat for being friendly and efficient. Contrary to what some reviews here will tell you, the Queen room is actually quite large for a hotel room. The problem is that it's really poorly designed. Most of the space is eaten up by the large kitchen/living room area, leaving the bed to be shoved in a super tight space closer to the bathroom. For a road warrior travelling alone, no sweat. If there's more than one person staying in the room, I could see the bed placement being a real issue, especially, say, when someone might need to stumble to the bathroom in the middle of the night. All in all, this is a clean, basic hotel with great service. I wouldn't really mind staying here again. There are however much better options for the same price nearby. Later in the week I had to extend my stay in the city, but the Residence Inn was fully booked, so I switched hotels and ended up paying the exact same price for a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, good price”
Reviews.Author: LLouise
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Residence Inn in Beverly Hills. The staff was very nice and friendly. We stayed in a one bedroom queen suite. The bedroom has barely enough room to walk in. You couldn't open the closet and the bathroom door at the same time. The room was clean and quiet. Except for the size of the room and complete lack of view of anything but another wall, it was up to Marriott standards. The location is good for the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: stargirl75
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I really enjoyed my stay. I got this last minute for a great price. I was staying by myself, so wanted to make sure that I got a safe, clean, nice place, and wouldnâ€™t have to have any stress . Please DO NOT get directions from the Hotel website though, I ended up quite lost, and aggravated after a 3 hour drive. BUT I called the Hotel and the great staff there walked me through getting to them perfectly, and were kind and gracious even when I called back several times. The room was clean, and really nice. Yes, the bathroom was a bit small, but it was only me so that was no biggie. They put me on the 7th floor, which made for a nice quiet stay. The breakfast was such a treat, and I had to leave every morning by 7:15, so no crowds that early. I have to share that on my first night, after I checked in, I took my kids down to the lobby to get picked up, and who got into the elevator but a Crackhead Trannie Hooker and her/his John. This was so bizarre, and I have to say probably not the norm for that hotel, but made for a good story when I got home. (Luckily the kids had no clue). My only real complaint is that they charge $22.00 a night for parking. Holy crap! That was like almost paying for another night at the Hotel after my weekend stay! But it was very nice, and even when they double charged my credit card for my stay, they instantly rectified it with great apologies

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: ponomo
Reviews.Content: My Stay at the Mariott Beverly Hills was pretty basic but Good. The rooms were very clean,and especially the Kitchen area. the LCD T.V. was a plus for my son who enjoyed watching Cartoon Network while I took care of business. The Location is pretty good, lots of resturants .75 miles north on Beverly Dr. Taxis always available but expensive, rent a car. Universal City Walk is 9.5 miles away and a $40.00 cab ride each way. my 6 y.o. son enjoyed City Walk and we sipped on Frappachino's and counted the RR Phantom's on Rodeo Dr. I stopped at 24 after about 30min. The FREE breakfast in the hotel is just that FREE. It's something to hold you til lunch. Eggs,French Toast,Sausage,Fruit, Sliced Peaches, and dry cereal for the kids. I tryed it once then was referred to Norms about a mile and a half west on Pico. It was a greasy spoon joint with good home cooked breakfast my son and I licked our plates. overall I will reccomend staying here again for Rates under $200.00 a night. P.S. Front desk staff was very nice and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: SissyH16
Reviews.Content: This place is GREAT! The location is not terribly central, but then LA is pretty spread out however to compensate they have a courtesy shuttle that will take you places within a reasonable distance to hotel. But the rooms are great. Full kitchens, big bathrooms, massive plasma screens with couches etc. They also have free wireless access. But to go the extra mile there is a free full breakfast and on Mon - Thurs there is also a happy hour every night with free wine and snacks. There is also a 'Market' with food and stuff to buy. Could not recommend this place more highly. Staff friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “OK But Mega Stuff Up At Check In”
Reviews.Author: OzTD
Reviews.Content: Arrived from Sydney at around 6.30am. Had booked the night befoore (and confirmed) to ensure I was able to check in very early in the morning. They had given my room away as I had not arrived by 9pm!!!!!! Not happy after a long haul flight! They told me to walk to Starbucks (10 mins away) and wait until room was ready. Waited to 12.30pm - no call so walked back to hotel and waited at reception. Finally in a room by 1.30pm. After the inital very very very bad setback the rest of the stay (5 nights) was fine. If you are planning to do something out of the ordinary in terms of aarrival time be wary. Otherwise fine for an extended enjoyable sstay

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Start to the New Year at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bustrvlr1975
Reviews.Content: My wife and two other couples spent the long New Year's weekend at this hotel. I am a Marriott frequent traveler recommended we stay here to our group and we were all very happy with this hotel. This hotel is more like a full service hotel than your typical apartment style Residence Inn. The rooms are all suites so each room has a full kitchen, living area and bedroom. The rooms are nicely furnished, newer looking and very clean. The best part is that each living room and bedroom has its own 32" flat panel TV. (came in very handy for the guys to watch two football games at the same time on NY Day! LOL) Full Breakfast is included in the rate and it was very nice with made to order omelettes, waffles, cereals, eggs, sausage, fruit, etc.... The dining room does get a little crowded at peak times, but people were moving through quickly and there is an adjacent meeting room that they open for breakfast seating too. We liked that since it was much quieter and roomier in there. The lobby is nice, warm and we loved the little wine and beer bar, although we only visited it once due to our busy schedule. The best thing about this place is the friendly and efficient staff. Very knowledgeable and eager to assist. We interacted frequently with the valet guys, the bell man, front desk and the breakfast staff and each one of them were outgoing, smiling all of the time. They even did our grocery shopping for us for free so that after a day of sight seeing we had the snacks and beer in one of our rooms waiting for us when we returned chilled in the refrigerator in the kitchen. Also, there is an awesome Jewish Deli (Factor's ??) a half block from the hotel that had huge great sandwiches. They also delivered to your hotel room too. As a frequent traveler, I am tired of getting charged for high speed interent hook up. This hotel had both wired and wireless throughout the building and it was free. Very much appreciated. We shopped around at the prices, location, etc... of many other hotels and we were very happy with our choice and location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff have attitude problems”
Reviews.Author: elwoodchiro
Reviews.Content: I should mention at the outset, that the night manager at this hotel was delightful....that is, unfortunately where it stopped. I don't even know where to begin... I asked the desk person the day after arriving if he could give me the AAA rate, as I read that it was available at this hotel...his attitude was that it wasn't worth looking up because there probably wasn't difference anyway......[what?????] Next, we had a problem with a crying baby in the next room....the walls must be like paper. reported at front desk....no response...they didn't care. went down for buffet breakfast...well, what a battle. there must have been twice the number of guests fighting for half the number of tables...one morning, we ended up just going out on the cold to eat. then there is the free shuttle that they advertise. Well, thats if they FEEL like taking you. I asked them one morning at around 9am to go somewhere and was told they were busy until 11am......i don't know what they were doing, but it wasn't shuttling people. Then, on our last day, I rang to make a shuttle booking at 8am. i was told straight out that the shuttle was booked out all day ....great service. when i complained at the front desk, they made a phone call and mysteriously there was a shuttle available in 15 minutes. Otherwise, the hotel was 'okay' Rooms are very tiny. One thing going for this hotel is location, location, location. But, next time, I think I'll stay at the Crowne Plaza which is right across the road, and hopefully, they will have staff that do give a damn.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bo94114
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night in a studio room. Hotel has a strange lay out and we drove right past it once. Valet parking with in and out privileges. Location is good. 2 free internet stations in the lobby. Standard Marriott dÃ©cor. Do not take a room that ends in 11. You will hear the elevators! It was all that was open when we arrived and we were only here 1 night so I thought no biggie. Wrong! Also there is a full size sliding door that opens into thin air! Mine would not lock so watch your kids. The air-con is in the corner alcove so air circulation to the bedding area is next to non existent. Bed is crammed in there so you can barely get out of it on 1 side and the TV credenza at the foot of the bed also blocks egress. The Kitchen and living area were great with lots of space. Free wi-fi and wired internet. The carpet baseboard was coming off in 1 corner. Bathroom had previous guestâ€™s hair in the tub and on the floor. Sink made a horrible noise when you turned the water on. You can not have the closet and the bathroom door open at the same time as they block each other. Some plaster issues in the bath. Breakfast was very busy and ended up eating in the bar area. It was a good selection for it being included. I will stay here again but making sure I am not near an elevator and will bring my own Swiffer to clean up the hair.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: oaklay18
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location over Thanksgiving. The room: Comfortable bed, flat screen tv and spacious. Amenities: Free breakfast daily with a large selection. M-F they have appetizers and happy hour for free. Parking is $20 dollars daily and there isn't anywhere close to maybe park and just walk to the hotel. They do allow in and out privileges No pool, but a nice sized whirlpool. The gym (although small) had a lot of nice equipment in it. Location: Close to a lot of major attractions. If you go further down Beverly there are lots of shops and food places Pinkberry, Chiptle etc. Not far from Sunset, La Brea, Melrose, Hollywood blvd etc. Even closer to Rodeo Dr. Century City mall is right down Pico. Grocery store (Ralphs) is right off Pico if you're looking to take full advantage of the kitchen. Very good location for the money. Great value, especially if traveling as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mcgavin-krause
Reviews.Content: We arrived around Midnight, and were questioning the surrounding neighborhood, but it ended up being okay in the long run. This is not a FANCY hotel, but it more than met our needs. The suite was very adequate in size for our family of four, and was very efficiently arranged. There was a full kitchen (and this is their base room), which included complimentary coffee and microwave popcorn. The bathroom area was slightly small, but we didn't spend much time in there anyway! The complimentary breakfast was tasty, but very crowded, and they were constantly trying to keep up with the demand for food and seating. On Sunday AM, we ended eating in the lobby, because the breakfast area was full, and even seating in the lobby was limited. One thing I really liked was that there was a manager out in the reception and lobby area 24 hours a day, and any issues were promptly dealt with in a very courteous manner. I also liked their directions service, where you can ask the desk attendant how to get to a specific spot, and they printed the directions out from a computer system they had behind the desk. The directions included both how to get to the destination and how to get back. It made getting around LA just a little easier than trying to navigate with a large paper map of the entire city. If you are expecting a five-star hotel, this probably wouldn't be your first choice, but it more than meets the needs of any business traveler, or a family on a get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect Mid-Range Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rufferta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while I attended a weekend exercise retreat. The hotel had been recommended by the retreat organizers and shuttle service back and forth to the gym was included. Among the many good features of the hotel: Complimentary hot breakfast buffet - better than average. For example, both scrambled and hard-boiled eggs, and two different kinds of yoghurt, in addition to the usual waffles, muffins, bagels, oatmeal and etc. The breakfast buffet was open for a three-hour window, so you didn't have to set your alarm so you wouldn't miss breakfast. The two mornings I was there they did not run out of anything. Tables were cleared promptly. The rooms had miniature kitchens with everything most people need to cook, including a full-sized refrigerator, microwave, small stove, toaster, and a dishwasher! Though I didn't use it, they offer to do your grocery shopping for you, and there is a complimentary social hour on most weeknights. Nice tv with good reception. I did not try the internet access but some people in our group used it with no problem. They also allow little frou-frou dogs with a deposit. I was in Room 102 and although the room layout was a little awkward and I had a nice view of the bus stop across the street I was not bothered by street noise. Note: the hotel is approximately a mile from the Wilshire end of Rodeo Drive. It is an easy walk if you don't have a lot of packages. What made it less than perfect for me: The parking situation. I have an older car. When I pulled into the parking entrance the valet looked at me, looked at my battered Toyota, and asked something like "Are you sure you are registered in this hotel?" I assured him I was, and let him park my car. This hurt my feelings , though, and I mentioned it to someone connected with the parking concession and wasn't going to mention it further until I picked up my car on Sunday and there were dirty water spots on the front and side windows. When I pay $20 a day to park my car I would at least expect to get it back in the same or better condition as when I left it! Fortunately I keep window cleaner and a towel in the car so I was able to clean the glass before I had to get on the freeway home. Next time I will park the car next to a sprinkler somewhere myself. By the way, if you are comparing hotels in the area, make sure they are quoting a figure that includes the occupancy tax. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay near Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: nyorker3331
Reviews.Content: great location close to all, very clean large junior suite large kitchen friendly acomodating staff.... the only thing missing is a pool for the kids to unwind after a long day... breakfest can improved a bit... will go back.

Reviews.Title: “handy place to stay for LA”
Reviews.Author: norm3vc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (Three nights) for the first part of our two week -plus holiday to LA and up to San Francisco. We wanted to visit Santa Monica and also Universal studios. We chose this hotel as it was between the two. We had a hire car - very easy with parking here. We had two bedrooms and two bathrooms between 4 of us. The sitting area had a pull out sofa bed. There was a good small kitchen with cooker and fridge. We found it to be clean, very adequate for our needs and the sofa bed was very comfortable for a teenager. The breakfast was extensive with cereals, porridge, waffles, omelettes to order, and toast, baguls etc. Everybody was very helpful and keen to explain routes, parking elsewhere or organise any tours we may want. We walked to Rodeo drive that first evening and found a wide variety of restaurants within easy reach of the hotel. Santa Monica and Universal were also easy drives. We would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular stay at the Beverly Hills Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: jazz99
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a delicious, FREE breakfast, FREE hotel shuttle, The staff were extremely friendly & accommodating. The rooms are very spacious and come complete with a full kitchen. The housekeeping of the hotel gets an "A+". I was very impressed and pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, decent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: loaded4bear
Reviews.Content: The location and the breakfast are two key reasons to stay here. The hotel staff is truly worthless. They are not helpful and are quite rude, aspiring actors I suppose. DO NOT VALET! Park across the street (directly across from the hotel main entrance) for about $8 per day, unlimited access. Save your parking money for food, youâ€™re going to need it. Lastly, the hotel pool is in the basement; don't plan on sunning by the pool outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms are terrible”
Reviews.Author: SteveInEsc
Reviews.Content: We chose this Residence Inn due to good experience with other Residence, Courtyard and other Marriott properties. Room 530 was awful. The bathroom area smelled from cigarette smoke (the entire hotel is non-smoking). One of the lamps was not working (bulb was replaced, but it cost me a $2 tip). It is long and skinny giving it a claustrophobic feeling. There is a mirror directly facing the toilet. Worst of all is the location of the air conditioner. The vent was directly over the bed. A seeming gale force icy wind would periodically freeze us in bed. We had to set the thermostat higher than we liked to avoid being iced over. Then in between icings, we would wake up too hot. Who ever designed this room and similar ones on other floors should lose their architect's license. We had requested a handicapped studio, but none were available. So we requested a room that would have the shortest walk from the elevator. I did not report the problem to hotel management, since nothing could be done about it. We weren't about to change rooms in the middle of the night. I adjusted the vent the best I could, to little avail. If you choose to stay here, specify some room other than x30 across from the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Circusfolk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for the first time traveler to LA like I was. Easy access to highways and close to major tourists attractions like Hollywood and Highland, Rodeo Drive and Santa Monica. They have a great hot breakfast everyday and there is a grocery store 2 blocks away to get snacks and beverages to stock your in room fridge. Pretty quiet area. Great helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for visiting Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: travelerLondonON
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4, including two small children, stayed here June 27-29 as part of our west coast vacation. Located at Pico and Beverly, this hotel is right beside Beverly Hills. We found this to be a convenient location to visit Beverly Hills, Bel Air, Santa Monica, Universal and Hollywood. The area feels fairly safe. We had a clean, modern 2 bedroom suite with a living room, kitchen, and two bathrooms. It was reasonably priced for such a large suite with a complimentary breakfast. We faced the interior of the hotel where there was no view, but we preferred this since we had no street noise at all. (In LA you won't spend much time in the suite anyways if you are a tourist). The valet parking was easy (no delays). There is a Ralph's grocery store within a short walking distance. Overall, we were pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: SCCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 3 nights over Easter in April. We have 2 teen daughters, so having 2 full bathrooms was great! The rooms were very newly decorated, clean, bright and efficient use of space. The beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms were small, but nice. We got a handicapped room, and I did not care for having the flip down seat in the shower, but it was not a big deal. Conveinant location - we day tripped to Rodeo Drive, Malibu, Santa Monica, Hollywood and Universal Studios - all with ease. I would definately stay here again, and I am pretty picky!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Residence Inn Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: seashell28
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Residence Inn Beverly Hills. We were looking for a clean hotel in a good LA location. While we were not close enough to walk to Rodeo drive, it was a short drive. We had a clean, spacious bedroom/livingroom/kitchen. It was quiet. We loved the full breakfast bar every morning. The staff could not have been any nicer. You do have to pay add'l for parking. Would definitely stay here again.
